story:
P.S. for the campaign video in English, press 'c', please :))

LT Pirmą kartą Lietuvoje - 33 valandas truksiantis performansas MO muziejuje, Vilniuje. 3 dienas vyksiantis veiksmas, paremtas šiuolaikinio šokio, muzikos ir šviesų instaliacijomis. Veiksmo atlikėjas - vienas kūnas, išgyvensiantis nenumanomas fizines bei psichologines transformacijas.

DATA: birželio 20 - 22, 2019 | LAIKAS: nuo 10:00 iki 22:00
VIETA: MO muziejus  (Pylimo g. 17, Vilnius 01141, Lietuva)

'st.One 33' nagrinėja žmogaus būties klausimus, sąmoningą ir nesąmoningą veiksmą, pasirinkimo galimybę. Tai susitikimas su savimi imanencinėje ir transcendencinėje erdvėse. Galimybė išvysti jų sąlyčio taškus. Santykis su akmens materija. Mitas. XXI a. vertybių klausimas. Riba tarp: "Aš esu - gyvūnas / žmogus / robotas"?

Šis projektas vystosi nuo 2014 metų. 'st.One' jau pristatytas įvairiose skirtingose platformose Nyderlanduose, Lietuvoje. Neseniai 'st.One' taip pat buvo pristatytas Venice Biennale | Anima Mundi Festival 2019 - RITUALS atidarymo renginyje (gegužės 12d., 2019). Festivalio parodoje eksponuojama performanso instaliacija (gegužės 12 - liepos 11 d., 2019).

Komanda:
idėjos autorė / atlikėja - Goda Žukauskaitė (NL / LT)
kūrybinė konsultantė / projekto vadovė - Inga Stankaitytė
muzikos autoriai ir atlikėjai - SOVIJUS
projekto video / foto menininkai - Jonas Urvakis, Aistė Jucytė - Urvakė
šviesų dailininkas - Andrius Stasiulis

'st.One' pristatymo video - https://youtu.be/Z6492WF7heQ

sek 'st.One' naujienas - https://www.facebook.com/stOne-435362850573153/  

daugiau apie 'st.One 33' - https://www.facebook.com/events/122057874148676... 

Projekto partneriai: MO Modernaus meno muziejus

EN The first time in Lithuania - 33 hours long performance in the MO Modern Art Museum in Vilnius, Lithuania. The performance is based on contemporary dance, music and light installations. The action is done by one human body while going through unpredictable physical and psychological transformations.

DATE: June 20 - 22, 2019 | TIME: from 10:00 to 22:00
PLACE: MO museum (Pylimo g. 17, Vilnius 01141, Lietuva)

'st.One 33' discovers the questions of human beings, conscious and unconscious actions, the power of choice. It is a meeting with yourself in the space of immanence and transcendence. The opportunity to see the connection in between. The relation with the material of stone. Myth. The question of values in the XXI century. The border in between: "I am - animal/human/robot?'

The project has been developed since 2014. Up until now 'st.One' was presented in different festivals / scenes around the Netherlands, Lithuania. Recently 'st.One" was presented at the opening ceremony Venice Biennale | Anima Mundi Festival 2019 (12th May). In the exhibition RITUALS the installation of the performance is taking a place (12th May - 11th July, 2019).

The team:
Performer / creator - Goda Žukauskaitė
Creative adviser - Inga Stankaitytė
Music - SOVIJUS
Project visual artists - Jonas Urvakis and Aistė Jucytė - Urvakė
Light designer - Andrius Stasiulis

'st.One' teaser - https://youtu.be/Z6492WF7heQ

follow 'st.One' - https://www.facebook.com/stOne-435362850573153/  

more info about 'st.One 33' - https://www.facebook.com/events/122057874148676... 

Partners: MO Modern Art Museum

 

Kodėl mums reikia Tavo paramos?

LT Kadangi 'st.One 33' yra performansas, kurį sunku priskirti prie įprasto šokio, muzikos ar teatro pasirodymo, susiduriame su projekto finansavimo problema. Štai kodėl mums reikalinga Jūsų pagalba! Performansas reikalauja didelio atsidavimo, energijos, darbo iš atlikėjo bei visos komandos. Norėtume turėti galimybę sumokėti žmonėms, padėsiantiems šio performanso įvykdymui, pasirūpinti atlikėjos saugumu performanso metu ir vystyti šį projektą toliau - atlikimo ir kūrybinių paieškų prasme. Paremdami 'st.One 33' Jūs padėsite mums padengti pačias reikalingiausias performanso išlaidas:

- akmenų tarnsportavimas;

- performanos erdvės įrengimas;

- technikos nuoma;

- medicininės apsaugos perfromanso metu užtikrinimas;

- reklama;

- užmokestis žmonės, dirbantiems prie performanso;

ir kt.

Why do we need your support?

EN Since 'st.One 33' is a performance which doesn’t really fit in regular frames as dance, theatre, music performance, it is quite hard to get financial support for it. This is why we need your help! This performance requires a lot of strength and commitment from the performer and from the team. We would like to get money in order to pay all people who are willing to help and invest their work in the project, have the extra money in order to take care of the performer's safety and have a possibility to bring this project further - performative and research-wise.  By supporting 'st.One 33' you will help us to deal with the most common practical stuff as:

- transportation of the stones;

- the building, preparing the performance space;

- the rent of technical equipment;

- medical care during the performance;

- publicity;

- payment for people working for the project

and etc,

Apie Godą

LT Goda Žukauskaitė (27.12.1993) – šiuolaikinio šokio atlikėja / kūrėja, šiuo metu gyvenanti ir dirbanti Amsterdame (Nyderlandai). Goda yra baigusi Amsterdamo Teatro ir Šokio Menų Akademiją, Modernaus Šokio Teatro specialybę. Ji yra šokio kompanijų Kalpanarts (NL), Schweigman& (NL) šokėja/ atlikėja. Taip pat aktyviai bendradarbiauja su individualiais Nyderlandų bei Lietuvos menininkais ir organizacijomis. Goda vysto "Gyvo Judesio Praktikos" metodą, atlieka "Performatyvios realybės' projektą / tyrimą, finansuojamą Lietuvos kultūros tarybos.

Goda yra šokusi choreografų Kalpana Raghuraman, Liat Waysbort, Boukje Schweigman, Blenard Azizaj, Peter Uray, Roser Lopez Espinoza, Julio Cesar Iglesias Ungo, Uri Ivgi & Johan Greben, Keren Levi, Peter Uray ir kt. darbuose.

daugiau informacijos apie Godą - www.godacome.com 

About Goda

EN Goda Žukauskaitė (27.12.1993) -  contemporary dancer, performer, creator based in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. She is graduated from Amsterdam Academy of the Arts, Modern Theatre Dance department (2018). Goda is currently dancing / performing in a few companies: “Kalpanarts” (NL), “Schweigman&” (NL), working with various independent artists and organisations around The Netherlands and Lithuania. Besides of this she is developing her own “Live Movement Practice” method, making a research “Performative Reality”, supported by Lithuanian Council for Culture.

Goda has been dancing in works from Liat Waysbort, Kalpana Raghuraman, Boukje Schweigman, Blenard Azizaj, Roser Lopez Espinosa, Julio Cesar Iglesias Ungo, Uri Ivgi & Johan Greben, Keren Levi, Peter Uray and others.

more info about Goda - www.godacome.com
 

Kiti rėmimo būdai

LT Skleisk žinią apie 'st.One'!

Pamėk ir pasidalink - https://www.facebook.com/stOne-435362850573153/

Ateik - https://www.facebook.com/events/122057874148676...

Jei norėtumėte paaukoti akmenų - visada lauksime! Jei turite kitų idėjų, kaip galėtumėte padėti ir prisidėti prie projekto - rašyk. Būsime labai dėkingi!

p.s. taip pat ieškome savanorių, norinčių prisidėti prie 'st.One 33' performanso! Užpildyk anketą čia: https://docs.google.com/…/1FAIpQLScjt1L4WJmWH...

Klausimai? Susisiekite su mumis - info@godacome.com 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Atsiprašome, jei projekto nepavyksta paremti dėl tam tikrų Indiegogo platformos trikdžių! Būsime dėkingi, jei tokiu atveju numatytą sumą pervesite tiesiai į projekto sąskaitą:

G ZUKAUSKAITE
NL30 INGB 0668 0335 33 

Norėdami gauti 'st.One' dovaną, darydami bankinį pavedimą laikykitės šių nurodymų:

- perveskite sumą nurodytą prie pasirinktos dovanos;

- pavedime nurodykite savo elektroninio pašto adresą. 

Iš anksto dėkojame! Kilus nesklandumams, visada galite kreiptis - info@godacome.com

 

Other ways to support

EN Spread the message about 'st.One'!

Like and Share - https://www.facebook.com/StOne-project-research...
Come - https://www.facebook.com/events/122057874148676...

If you would like to donate some stones, you are always very welcome to do so.  Or if you have some other ideas on how you could support the project - feel free to share! 

p.s. we are also searching for volunteers, who would like to help during the 'st.One 33' performance! Fill in a form here: https://docs.google.com/…/1FAIpQLScjt1L4WJmWH... 

Questions? Contact us - info@godacome.com
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are sorry if you cannot support the project because of some interference on the Indiegogo platform. We would be thankful if you would transfer the money straight to the project account:

G ZUKAUSKAITE

NL30 INGB 0668 0335 33

If you would like to receive a special 'st.One' present by doing a direct transfer, please follow these instructions:

- transfer the exact amount as suggested next to the item;

- provide your e-mail address as a reference.

Thank you in advance! If you experience some problems, you can always contact us - info@godacome.com
story_txt:
P.S. for the campaign video in English, press 'c', please :))LT Pirmą kartą Lietuvoje - 33 valandas truksiantis performansas MO muziejuje, Vilniuje. 3 dienas vyksiantis veiksmas, paremtas šiuolaikinio šokio, muzikos ir šviesų instaliacijomis. Veiksmo atlikėjas - vienas kūnas, išgyvensiantis nenumanomas fizines bei psichologines transformacijas.
DATA: birželio 20 - 22, 2019 | LAIKAS: nuo 10:00 iki 22:00VIETA: MO muziejus  (Pylimo g. 17, Vilnius 01141, Lietuva)'st.One 33' nagrinėja žmogaus būties klausimus, sąmoningą ir nesąmoningą veiksmą, pasirinkimo galimybę. Tai susitikimas su savimi imanencinėje ir transcendencinėje erdvėse. Galimybė išvysti jų sąlyčio taškus. Santykis su akmens materija. Mitas. XXI a. vertybių klausimas. Riba tarp: "Aš esu - gyvūnas / žmogus / robotas"?
Šis projektas vystosi nuo 2014 metų. 'st.One' jau pristatytas įvairiose skirtingose platformose Nyderlanduose, Lietuvoje. Neseniai 'st.One' taip pat buvo pristatytas Venice Biennale | Anima Mundi Festival 2019 - RITUALS atidarymo renginyje (gegužės 12d., 2019). Festivalio parodoje eksponuojama performanso instaliacija (gegužės 12 - liepos 11 d., 2019).Komanda:idėjos autorė / atlikėja - Goda Žukauskaitė (NL / LT)kūrybinė konsultantė / projekto vadovė - Inga Stankaitytėmuzikos autoriai ir atlikėjai - SOVIJUSprojekto video / foto menininkai - Jonas Urvakis, Aistė Jucytė - Urvakėšviesų dailininkas - Andrius Stasiulis'st.One' pristatymo video - https://youtu.be/Z6492WF7heQ
sek 'st.One' naujienas - https://www.facebook.com/stOne-435362850573153/  daugiau apie 'st.One 33' - https://www.facebook.com/events/122057874148676... 
Projekto partneriai: MO Modernaus meno muziejusEN The first time in Lithuania - 33 hours long performance in the MO Modern Art Museum in Vilnius, Lithuania. The performance is based on contemporary dance, music and light installations. The action is done by one human body while going through unpredictable physical and psychological transformations.DATE: June 20 - 22, 2019 | TIME: from 10:00 to 22:00PLACE: MO museum (Pylimo g. 17, Vilnius 01141, Lietuva)'st.One 33' discovers the questions of human beings, conscious and unconscious actions, the power of choice. It is a meeting with yourself in the space of immanence and transcendence. The opportunity to see the connection in between. The relation with the material of stone. Myth. The question of values in the XXI century. The border in between: "I am - animal/human/robot?'
The project has been developed since 2014. Up until now 'st.One' was presented in different festivals / scenes around the Netherlands, Lithuania. Recently 'st.One" was presented at the opening ceremony Venice Biennale | Anima Mundi Festival 2019 (12th May). In the exhibition RITUALS the installation of the performance is taking a place (12th May - 11th July, 2019).The team:Performer / creator - Goda ŽukauskaitėCreative adviser - Inga StankaitytėMusic - SOVIJUSProject visual artists - Jonas Urvakis and Aistė Jucytė - UrvakėLight designer - Andrius Stasiulis'st.One' teaser - https://youtu.be/Z6492WF7heQ
follow 'st.One' - https://www.facebook.com/stOne-435362850573153/  more info about 'st.One 33' - https://www.facebook.com/events/122057874148676... 
Partners: MO Modern Art Museum
 
Kodėl mums reikia Tavo paramos?
LT Kadangi 'st.One 33' yra performansas, kurį sunku priskirti prie įprasto šokio, muzikos ar teatro pasirodymo, susiduriame su projekto finansavimo problema. Štai kodėl mums reikalinga Jūsų pagalba! Performansas reikalauja didelio atsidavimo, energijos, darbo iš atlikėjo bei visos komandos. Norėtume turėti galimybę sumokėti žmonėms, padėsiantiems šio performanso įvykdymui, pasirūpinti atlikėjos saugumu performanso metu ir vystyti šį projektą toliau - atlikimo ir kūrybinių paieškų prasme. Paremdami 'st.One 33' Jūs padėsite mums padengti pačias reikalingiausias performanso išlaidas:
- akmenų tarnsportavimas;
- performanos erdvės įrengimas;
- technikos nuoma;
- medicininės apsaugos perfromanso metu užtikrinimas;
- reklama;
- užmokestis žmonės, dirbantiems prie performanso;
ir kt.
Why do we need your support?

- transportation of the stones;
- the building, preparing the performance space;
- the rent of technical equipment;
- medical care during the performance;
- publicity;
- payment for people working for the project
and etc,

story:
The Show's Origins & Impact

This play was a pivotal moment in our playwright's journey to motherhood, and it healed the open wounds left behind from failed pregnancy attempts and anxiety-riddled sleepless nights. 

Our performance dates will be: 

Tuesday, August 6th @ 5pm 

Wednesday, August 7th @ 8pm 

Friday, August 9th @ 2pm

Wednesday, August 21st @ 8pm

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce the best version of this play, we need to gather support and funding from people like YOU!

Our current goal is to raise $5,000. The funds will be used as follows:

Creative Staff & Actors: $3,000

Production Costs: $1,250

Marketing and Outreach: $500

IndieGoGo Fees: $250

We will be working exclusively with the budget we get from this campaign. That means the more money we raise, the better our production will be!

Now...let's talk about PERKS!

Our production team is gathering all kinds of merchandise and opportunities to offer as perks for everyone who donates to our campaign. Even the smallest donation will receive a little something for their generosity.

Our merchandise will include:

Exclusive BASIC GLITCH buttons, t-shirts, and tote bags

Playbills signed by the cast, crew, & production team of BASIC GLITCH

Free tickets to BASIC GLITCH at Theatre Row's Lion Theatre on 42nd St

Feeling particularly generous?

With any donation of $100 or more, you can have an INVESTOR credit in the show’s official program.

But why stop there?

Donate $250 or more and get an EXECUTIVE PRODUCER credit in our Playbill and executive bragging rights as an Off-Broadway producer!

And there is nothing glitchy about that!

Risks & Challenges

Producing anything in the theatre world can be tricky, but our production team is up to the challenge! We have all worked in NYC theatre, both in festivals and full-length productions, as well as having accomplished careers throughout the U.S.

This is a large undertaking, and we are anxious to take our first steps into the Theatre Row complex on 42nd Street.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways to support, such as:

Telling friends and family about the production (and trying to recruit them as donors!)

Spreading the word about our production on social media

Liking our pages, writing supportive comments, and subscribing to our updates

Sharing our social media posts with your followers

All Glitches Aside...

We wouldn’t be reaching out if we didn’t believe in what we have to offer, and we hope you can believe in us, too. Any ounce of generosity helps, and we’re so excited to share this story.

Thank you for supporting BASIC GLITCH!

story:
Short Summary

Our goal is to do our part to revitalize the empty storefronts on State Street by renting one out the week of October 12th. Our goal for that week is to feature local artists, musicians, dancers, and non-profits. If the role of the artist is to make the revolution irresistible, we believe that artists should be at the revolution’s forefront - and the revitalization of State Street is a deeply needed movement towards change in our city.

Our work, as SELAH, has never been just about us. We believe in making dance accessible and relatable to all people, especially in a city that has supported us for the past five years. Santa Barbara has become an amazing hub for dance on the West Coast and we are honored to be a part of it, alongside artists and organizations with so many different interests, influences, and histories. Our goal with this event is to create an experience in which all artists can take part and everyone in Santa Barbara is welcome. We are partnering with many local artists and organizations alike to bring this vision to life.  

What We Need & What You Get

We cannot do this alone and are looking for local support to make this event a success. Here's what we are asking for and what you get if you choose to support our fundraiser!

  • Breakdown of our fundraising ask:
    • $3000 for renting out an entire space on State Street. We already have some possible donations of lighting, sound, and vintage furniture to help us furnish the space. Now we just need somewhere to put them!
    • $1200 in artist's fees to cover the cost of working with our collaborators
    • $1500 to cover working with the best event manager in the city of Santa Barbara, Eji Experiences
    • $300 to cover expenses related to insurances and other event necessities
  • At the various levels of donation, you will be able to claim complimentary general admission tickets to our show in the space OR our special VIP dinner event, catered by a local restaurant with a menu specially devised to pair with our VIP-only dinner and dance performance.
  • Whatever we fundraise will be used for this event. We are passionate about providing a platform for others to share their art and we hope to make this the best event of the year.

The Impact

In the past, we have supported artists from Los Angeles, San Francisco, Orange County, Austin, and New York City by providing a space for them to share their work and to create networks of like-minded artists with big visions and dreams. 

»The role of the artist is to make the revolution irresistible.«
- Toni Cade Bambara 2011

Downtown Santa Barbara is currently full of empty storefronts and we hope to bring a little more life, even if just for a short time, back to downtown. If the role of the artist is to make the revolution irresistible, we believe that artists should be at the revolution’s forefront - and the revitalization of State Street is a deeply needed movement towards change in our city.

Our work, as SELAH, has never been just about us. Our work straddles the contemporary/modern aesthetic and while we have many influences, we want to highlight other amazing artists who do not share the same aesthetics as we do. Providing a literal space for others to share what they have created or what means most to them is the most powerful thing we can do with the platform that we have. We have invited dozens of local artists and organizations to participate in our evening and have been overwhelmed with the support and excitement about our event. And we hope that you are excited too!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to our campaign, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out about our event! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share our event on your social media streams if you'd like, or just tell your friends and family.
  • Come to our shows during the week of October 12-19. We will have a ton of family-friendly events, installations, free classes, and multiple performances that we aim to make accessible and relatable to all people.
  • Want to donate but don't want to give cash? We are looking for local sponsors to assist with food, wine, beer, and other event necessities. Want to donate something for our fundraiser in September, even better!
  • Volunteer with us! There are many opportunities to work with us on this event. It will require a lot of hands and a lot of helpers. If you'd like to get involved with helping us produce this show, please email us at info@selahdancecollective.com and we will connect you.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you! We hope to see you in October.

Come to our shows during the week of October 12-19. We will have a ton of family-friendly events, installations, free classes, and multiple performances that we aim to make accessible and relatable to all people.
Want to donate but don't want to give cash? We are looking for local sponsors to assist with food, wine, beer, and other event necessities. Want to donate something for our fundraiser in September, even better!
Volunteer with us! There are many opportunities to work with us on this event. It will require a lot of hands and a lot of helpers. If you'd like to get involved with helping us produce this show, please email us at info@selahdancecollective.com and we will connect you.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you! We hope to see you in October.

story:
Hello!

We’re Riaan Smit and Deborah Vieyra. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to invite you into our project!

In 2018, we came together to form A Room Somewhere as a vehicle to produce esteemed South African playwright Athol Fugard’s “Hello and Goodbye” for a Vancouver audience.

We are, as so many of you might be, multi-homed. As South African-Canadians and professional theatre artists, we see the artistic space as a means of fostering cross-cultural dialogue between the countries that define home for us. What better way to bind our geographies than through the spice route of words that Fugard has given us?

We have assembled a team of passionate and talented individuals to help us on our quest. Introducing...!

  • Acclaimed South African theatre practitioner, Bo Petersen, will serve as the director of the production.
  • Classically trained violist, Thomas Beckman, will be composing original music for us.
  • The bubbly and bright Olivia Etey will be keeping us afloat as Stage Manager
  • Keagan Elrick brings their discerning and keen eye to our show as lighting designer
  • Finally, Kimira Bhikum will be putting her deft creative hands to bear as Stage and Props Designer

While we have an abundance of creative currency, we seem to be a little lacking in the dollar department. Theatre is expensive and the onus of taking on the risk of production often falls on the artists themselves. For this reason, we need your help bringing this important work to life.

So yes, we’re hoping you too can be part of our team in some way so that we can make this production the best it can possibly be! We’ve put together a menagerie of enticing perks to lure you in, each with its own relevancy to the play. (Careful, they are indeed very seductive. Binge-perking may occur.)

The Play

At this point, you may want to know a little more about this rubik’s cube of a play, so here goes:

Set in the home of a poor white family in 1960s Apartheid South Africa, “Hello and Goodbye” conjures the repercussions of evaporating identity. When all that you have been taught defines you is an authoritative regime and a guilt-driven religious tradition, where do you find your own narrative, your own story? 

In a literary dance that steps between Beckett-like absurdity and the realism of Sam Shepard or Tennessee Williams, Fugard does a deep dive into a family torn apart by a toxic mix of self-loathing, lethal patriarchy, and the violence of the country in which it is set. The domestic collides with the political, as the two characters reconnect (and disconnect) in their childhood home, rummaging through the remnants of their lives in search of redemption, a father figure, legitimacy and cold, hard cash.

Into it? We thought you might be. So here’s what we need:

What We Need & What You Get

Here’s what we’ve already covered:

  1. We have the rights to the play! Marvelous.
  2. We’ve paid the deposit for the space (The NEST, formerly Studio 1398 on Granville Island). Awesome.
  3. We’ve partnered with Vancouver-based South African organizations to get in touch with the local community and see how we can form mutually beneficial partnerships. (One of these is the all-too-wonderful Education Without Borders. Check them out.)
  4. We’ve done the nitty gritty like get insurance, a publicity machine up and running, and started scouting props, scenery and costumes.
  5. We have a plan to get a bar up and running every night so that nobody goes thirsty.
  6. We’re absolutely 100% immersed in the material. Rehearsals are already underway.

Here’s what we still need:

  1. Theatre rental fee for two weeks at The NEST, including staffing costs. 

  2. Travel for Bo Petersen, our director, from South Bend, Indiana, where she lives to Vancouver, Canada, where we do.
  3. We are asking for $5500 to cover our venue costs and travel for our director. Below you can see a detailed breakdown of how we will used the funding we receive from you:

Here’s what you’ll get:

Of course, the main benefit you will get is knowing that you have been an instrumental part of ensuring that independent theatre is live and well. You will have helped us bring this great work to a Vancouver audience.

But it doesn’t end there:

Remember those perks we mentioned? Take a seat, because we’re about to give you the highlights package:

At the top end of our perk spectrum, we are offering an exclusive performance of “Hello and Goodbye” in the comfort of your own home. What? Yes, amazing, we know! 

Then, one tier down from that, we will invite you to enjoy your own home-cooked South African meal with the cast and crew of the play. Delicious in every way.

Our other perks range from a romantic date night, with two tickets and drinks at the play, to personalized shout outs to your very own poster when you come to see the play.

Each of our perks have been named from lines directly from the play. 

The Impact

The worth of theatre to catalyze productive dialogue and form cross-cultural ties is unparalleled. Never has this been more needed than in a world where elements of exclusionary nationalism and cultural isolation surface violently in our news streams. The immediacy of live performance brings audiences into direct contact with the Other, confronting difference in a manner that promotes reflection rather than violence.

Theatre has long been an instrumental part of South Africa’s complex history and its young democracy, and was an active force in the dismantling of Apartheid’s oppressive structures. Athol Fugard’s work brought together racially diverse performers in theatre spaces, in a time and place when this simple act was illegal. To understand this legacy is to appreciate the full weight of
what artistic practice is able to achieve as a means of bringing about societal change.

Our aim is to bring this spirit of political dynamism to the theatre we produce, and create theatre that encourages productive discomfort.

We hope to pollinate the local Vancouver landcape with a theatrical and literary tradition that will help to diversify it. In doing so, we hope to open channels of dialogues, foster interest and help contribute to a Canada that has room for all the cultural backgrounds that make it up.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to help financially, there are other ways you can contribute. Please help us by sharing our campaign far and wide so that we can make our production a reality.

And, of course, come and see the show! 

We look forward to seeing you on Granville Island soon!

story:
Who We Are

SOTO + TOWER is a boundary blurring multidisciplinary team that creates whimsical, visually enticing stage works using dance, theater, music, and multimedia design. Each work is an interdisciplinary collaboration rooted in storytelling, community activation and research. Ranging from humorous to horrifying, SOTO + TOWER highlights the absurdity of human existence. SOTO + TOWER has been featured in Seattle's most prominent publications, and has received support from 4Culture, Seattle Office of Arts and Culture, Cornish Arts Incubator, Velocity Dance Center, and 10degrees.

For more information visit MayaSotoDance.com and NicoTowerStudios.com

 

What We Are Fundraising For

[persIst] features a cast of 5 dynamic performers including Maya and Nico, onstage together, joined by concert violinist Dr. Jo Nardolillo. This work signifies 5 years of flourishing collaboration and will be the last performance created solely in Seattle, before the pair goes bi-coastal this summer. 

This project takes an immediate, sincere look at tenacity and the makings of grit. It is a study of perseverance. What strategies do we use to keep going when we are physically and emotionally exhausted? The ensemble explores relationship dynamics and individual struggles in the current sociopolitical climate.  [persIst] will premiere at the Seattle International Dance Festival, June 11 & 12, 2019 at Erickson Theater.

Art provides people with unique opportunities to process the relevant issues of the world around them. By donating YOU become an active part of the artistic community. Stay tuned for details about open rehearsals and public discussions.

Creating all the aspects of [persIst] takes an incredible amount of time, energy, and passion. Donating to this campaign will help compensate artists for their work. This project is made possible by a prestigious award from the James Ray Residency Project in partnership with Seattle International Dance Festival.  

Now, we need YOUR help to raise funds to pay the artists for their time and unique skills.

Your contribution is crucial for making this work come to life and creating opportunities for dancers to earn a living using their specialized skills.

What it costs...

$404 :: Rehearsal space (beyond the residency)

$800 :: Props / costume materials 

$5850 :: Rehearsal stipends for artists ($1170 per artist)

$1200 :: 6 performance stipends (6 performers x $100 per performance x 2 shows)

$46 :: hosting for 4 years - project website

$700 :: Indigogo Fees (8% + .30 per credit card transaction)

$9,000 :: TOTAL EXPENSES


As you know, the cost of creating art is high.

Fees for directing, choreography, original sound score, lighting design, pre-show photography/video, administrative and design work are not included here. These creative costs are being met through work as teaching artists and in-kind donations.

The exciting perks of donating include personalized thank you videos, the [persIst] (mp3 recording),  a champagne toast with the artists, and more. 

Risks & Challenges

Funding for dance is scarce. 

Paying artists is a priority. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate but still want to be a part of the project?

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN, recommend it to a friend!

Give a shout out on social media

Attend an open showing & community discussion

Come to the premiere, June 11 & 12, 2019 @ Erickson Theater off Broadway.

story:
Who We Are

Founded in 2012 by three inspired friends, Barefoot Shakespeare Company is a not-for-profit dedicated to bringing Shakespeare's work to a wide, diverse audience. Striving to create work that is grounded, accessible and applicable, we seek to dissolve the divide between spectator and performer. 

Barefoot has a pedestrian, engaging and modern outlook on the Bard. As a co-founder once aptly put it: "Shakespeare through a lens of the Americana". Located in New York City, Barefoot takes full advantage of the beauty of Manhattan's iconic Central Park to bring Shakespeare alive against the backdrop of a specifically American place and time.

What We Need

In the midst of our seventh season, we stand mostly in awe of our community. We provide a platform for young New York theater artists to not only hone their performance skills but explore and grow in various aspects of production. A vital portion of our success is owed to those who have participated in our Production Apprentice program and other artists who have, year after year, volunteered their time and talent to our productions.

These creatives have shaped us into the company that we are, and it's time we compensate their efforts (and the efforts of all artists) rightly. But we need your help. 

What You Get

By donating to our 2019 Season Campaign, you will be putting money into the pockets of our two summer casts and production teams: from actors and directors to designers and stage managers.

Join us on our 40-day journey to raise $5,000. Not only could you earn one or more of our exciting perks, but you yourself will become part of the Barefoot community.

Unable to make a financial contribution? We still value your support: Use Indiegogo's Share Tools to get the word out via social media and come say hello at our upcoming production of Lady Capulet.

story:
Short Summary

'Helium' is the debut production of Grumble Pup, a theatre company founded in Reading and dedicated to putting on challenging new work. Originally intended for the Edinburgh Fringe 2020, the pandemic changed our plans, and we are now pleased to say that Helium is programmed for The Space's summer season 2021! 

Helium is a story about regret, despair, and reconciliation. It is inspired by the story of Sharlotte Hydorn, a kindly old woman who began to sell suicide kits after the prolonged death of her husband. It aims to explore the fallout of tragedy, and how we can come together in spite of it.

We are looking to raise some money to ensure that we can cover the expenses of the talented mix of artists working on the project, and to allow us to get our work seen and our story heard!

What We Need & What You Get

  • All the money will go towards helping us cover every expense of the cast and crew. Fringe theatre is a challenging industry, and we don't want to place a financial burden on the artists we work with (all those tube journeys can add up!). 
  • All of the funds from our stretch goals will be split between cast and crew for their time and talents. 
  • But, of course, we'd love to give back what we can. As well as exclusive content from the rehearsal room on our mailing list, donors will receive. . . 
  1. £5: Thank you! Your name in the program, and our undying gratitude. 
  2. £15: Super thank you! A lovely personalised thank you card, signed by the whole Helium team, plus all of the above..
  3. £25: Mega thank you! A personalised thank-you video from the writer, a video sneak peak behind the scenes, plus all of the above.
  4. £50: Helium insider! A full video compilation of Behind the Scenes footage from the production process, plus all of the above. 
  5. £100: Party time! A limited edition PartyPlanet party bag, filled with custom goodies from the show, a special edition program, and all the above.
  6. £150: Swag bag! A Grumble Pup branded t-shirt or hat, tote-bag, and signed poster, plus all of the above. 
  7. £250: Front row seats! Come along to a rehearsal, meet the writer and creative team, and all of the above.

The Impact

The effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on the arts industry has been enormous. Several members of our team have been unable to work longterm because of social distancing guidelines, and we are adamant not to add to the financial burden faced by the artists we work with. 

We are doing everything we can on our end to treat our collaborators fairly. We are operating an open financial book, sharing profits equally among company members, and offering a guaranteed minimum expenses contribution. Still, the financial realities of the theatre industry make it extremely difficult to do so without facing losing a lot of money. 

Your donation will help us to put on challenging and important work, while ensuring that all our collaborators are treated fairly. Helium is the first step to developing our platform, and will allow all of our emerging artists to hone their craft in front of a demanding public audience, without needlessly increasing their stress day-to-day.

Risks & Challenges

As a show originally intended to debut in Summer 2020, we are confident that we will be able to overcome any obstacles we face in the process of making this play a reality. Still, there are a few things we are conscious of as we go forward:

  • We want Helium to be experienced by as broad a demographic as possible, one representative of the community local to The Space in East London, but also the UK as a whole. To achieve this we are offering a livestream with low-income tickets at £5, and reaching out to local charities and community groups to ensure that we are keeping our work accessible.
  • It can be hard marketing a show with so many other excellent shows out there. To do this, we have secured a number of trailers in-kind to contribute to our curated marketing campaign, as well as networking via our weekly #sofashows series on Twitter. 
  • Even though it looks like it's on the way out, coronavirus is still, of course, at the back of our minds. We will be doing everything we can to ensure safety at our rehearsals and performances, and should COVID decide to rear its ugly head all funds raised will go straight towards staging the show at a later, safer date. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign, don't sweat it! There are all sorts of other things that will help make Helium a reality:

  • Come and see the show! Buy yourself a ticket for the live show or livestream at https://space.org.uk/whats-on/
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools to share this campaign!
  • Follow us on our socials! Twitter: @agrumblypup   Instagram: @grumblepuptheatre
  • Tell everyone you think might be interested! Spread the Grumble Pup word.

We will be doing everything we can to ensure safety at our rehearsals and performances, and should COVID decide to rear its ugly head all funds raised will go straight towards staging the show at a later, safer date. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to this campaign, don't sweat it! There are all sorts of other things that will help make Helium a reality:

Come and see the show! Buy yourself a ticket for the live show or livestream at https://space.org.uk/whats-on/

Use the IndieGoGo share tools to share this campaign!
Follow us on our socials! Twitter: @agrumblypup   Instagram: @grumblepuptheatre
Tell everyone you think might be interested! Spread the Grumble Pup word.

story:
DUE TO THE CO-VID 19 PANDEMIC, ODD MAN OUT HAS BEEN POSTPONED TILL SPRING 2021. 
But rest assured, we can't wait to get it going!

 

Three international theater companies have come together to create a new, one-of-a-kind performance, experienced entirely in the dark. This new style, supported by a groundbreaking methodology that promotes inclusivity, innovation, and diversity, promises to completely change the face of American theater. 

And we need your help to make it happen. 

 

  

In a pitch-black room, a dying, blind Argentinian tango musician recalls the story of his life. What follows is a whirlwind of evocative, sensorial memories: his first braille lesson, his first day of school, his first love, his first heartbreak, and his journey across continents.  What does music sound like in the dark? How do you describe a color when you can’t see it? What does the color of our skin and the sound of our voices feel like? What do you see instead, when you can’t see? Experienced entirely in the dark, Odd Man Out’s world and characters are brought to life by six actors through a dynamic and immersive sound design, delicate choreography, and an innovative use of smell and touch. The production builds upon the groundbreaking performance style developed by Argentinian company, Teatro Ciego, and takes it to new and thrilling heights. The result is a completely immersive experience that awakens all the senses, unleashes the imagination, and stimulates each and every part of the body.

 

The piece is an international collaboration between two North American theatre companies, Theatre C and Cuchame Theatre Co, with recognized Argentinian theatre company, Teatro Ciego, who over its 15 year history has focused on creating pitch-black experiences developed and performed by blind and low-vision artists. In line with that mission, the US premiere of the piece in Fall 2020 will also include an American cast of majority blind and low-vision artists, bringing awareness to the creative impact of an often-ignored artistic community. The partnership is the largest international collaboration these companies has ever undertaken, and was kicked off by the Spanish premiere of the piece in November 2019, in Buenos Aires, Argentina, to rave reviews. Planned for the fall of 2020, the US premiere will be preceded by an extended residency at the Teatro Ciego space in Argentina, where an American cast will train in the Teatro Ciego method. The project is more than a theater piece: it is an international exchange that seeks to create lasting relationships, catalyze creative collaborations across continents, and bring innovative new methods to the American theater landscape. 

Want to know more about these incredible companies? Check out their websites below!

TEATRO CIEGO - http://teatrociego.org/

CUCHAME THEATER CO - https://www.cuchame.org/

THEATRE C - http://www.theatrec.org/

 

We are raising $50,000 to bring the production to New York City in the Fall of 2020.

Every penny raised goes directly to paying and supporting the work of artists: performers, designers, musicians, writers, coordinators, and crew. Any additional funds will go to obtaining and securing the small production elements that go into the show, ranging from props to speakers. The $50,000 would cover both the extended residency in Argentina, as well as the work and time dedicated to rehearsing and presenting the work in NYC. Even if we don't reach our full goal, every dollar raised will still be directed to cover those costs. Odd Man Out is committed to, above all, supporting the work of underrepresented artists, and every cent helps.

But your support comes with perks! Take a look at all the exciting perks that come with each donation amount: they range from thank you's, to unique, one-of-a-kind merchandise from the show in Argentina, tickets to the run in New York, and a number of customized pitch-black experiences designed for you!

 

Odd Man Out is a revolutionary project on many fronts. Artistically, there are few companies with the amount of experience and success as Teatro Ciego has in developing and creating experiences in the dark. For the past 15 years, the company has been at the forefront of creating and developing pitch-black productions across the world for all ages and situations, and has partnered with companies like Google, Nike, and Disney to create unique, never-before-seen aural and spatial experiences. In the US, some companies have experimented with experiences in the dark, but none to the scale, design, and full sensorial level of Odd Man Out. Supporting this piece would mean supporting a never-before-seen creative methodology and practice, and help usher in a new phase in the American theatre experience.

Yet perhaps more excitingly, Odd Man Out is groundbreaking in creating new opportunities for an often-ignored within the arts: blind and low-vision individuals. Creating work in the dark provides an equal playing field for actors with varying levels of visual ability, and promotes new and exciting ways of creating meaning and emotion. In line with the mission of Teatro Ciego in Argentina, the performing ensemble of Odd Man Out in the US will be a majority of blind and low-vision artists. To support the reach and impact of the piece, Odd Man Out is collaborating with Alie B. Gorrie, an artist and activist that seeks to educate and empower individuals around disability.  Supporting this piece is revolutionary not only artistically: it is a radical statement in inclusivity, diversity, and creating space for new voices within the American artistic landscape.

 

Creating ground-breaking work is complicated.

Creating a new artistic piece is hard. Creating a new artistic piece that is revolutionary and groundbreaking is even harder.  Odd Man Out is a project that consists of a lot of moving pieces, both on the stage and behind the scenes. Many different people, ideas, and institutions across continents are coming together, and keeping a clear line of communication and management is key. The main challenge for the production is its incredible ambition: such a global collaboration is rare within the theater. Furthermore, creating anything new requires a dedicated attention to increasing visibility, spreading the word, and creating a brand, which can be grueling in such a media-filled place like New York City.

Odd Man Out has assembled an incredible team to make sure all of these challenges are faced head-on. Teatro Ciego has over 15 years of experience creating pitch-black experiences, and is managing most of the artistic development of the piece. Cuchame has ample experience as a link between Argentina and the American artistic landscape, and will head most of the logistics and management of the production. This will also be supported in large part by the incredible team at Brierpatch Productions, a general management office that brought incredible productions like Fuerza Bruta to New York with huge success. Theatre C, a company celebrating its 10th year producing and developing a wide range of works in the Off-Broadway landscape, acts as executive producer, and has brought in an incredible range of outside consultants to make sure the work has impact, reach, sustainability and success.

Any support you give will be in good and trustworthy hands.

 

Can't donate right now?
You can still give us a hand!

Spread the word! Share the campaign! Tell your friends! Make some noise! Any mention, share, comment, like, or post helps us create visibility, and we need all the visibility we can get!

story:
Fulfill Isabel's dancing dream



Het verhaal van Isabel, (English translation page down)

‘Als ik diep in een dans bezig ben, dan ben ik anders. Dan… dans ik mijn eigen verhaal en zit ik in een andere wereld...zo gek!’


Vier jaar is Isabel als ze in haar roze maillot en balletpakje haar eerste vrolijke danspasjes maakt. Vanaf dat moment zijn al haar dagen gevuld met dans en ballet. Nu, bijna twaalf jaar later, is er naast die vrolijkheid ook een steeds dieper verlangen gegroeid om op een dag professioneel te dansen. 

Isabel is 15 jaar en zit in het derde jaar van de Havo/VWO voor Muziek en Dans (HMD) Codarts in Rotterdam. Naast haar normale vakken volgt ze ruim 20 uur dansles per week.  Ze werkt hard, maakt lange dagen en is inmiddels per bus en trein al 3,5 keer rond de wereld gereisd voor haar dansopleiding. En dit is nog maar het begin.

Elke ochtend rond  half 7 stapt Isabel in de bus, dan begint haar anderhalf uur durende reis naar Rotterdam. ’s Avonds gaat ze dezelfde weg terug naar Wijk bij Duurstede.  Zo werkt ze iedere dag opnieuw keihard aan haar grote droom!

Waar veel kleine ballerina’s hun tutu uiteindelijk verknippen tot feestaccessoire, hield Isabel onverzettelijk vast aan haar droom. Nu haar idealen steeds meer binnen handbereik lijken te komen, is ze meer dan ooit vastberaden door te gaan op deze weg. Koste wat het kost. Ze blijft groeien als danser, en haar droom groeit ook!

Isabel haar ambitie is om ooit deel uit te maken van haar grote voorbeeld; het Nederlandse Dans Theater (NDT). Isabel werd verliefd op de combinatie van moderne dans en de hedendaagse en klassieke ballet van dit gezelschap. Het geeft haar het gevoel dat je met kunst dingen kunt veranderen en verrijken in de wereld.

Serieuze dansstudenten moeten ook hun zomers verstandig gebruiken en niet alleen genieten van een ontspannen zomervakantie!  Isabel wil werken aan haar danscarrière en volgt  een ‘Summer School’.  Daar verbetert ze haar vaardigheden en kracht, en maakt ze nieuwe contacten in de danswereld. Het is een enorme verrijking om een paar weken met andere gemotiveerde jonge dansers te trainen onder leiding van inspirerende professionals. Deze zomer is Isabel geselecteerd voor een Summer School van 2 weken bij de Dutch Don’t Dance Divison.

Het is uitdagend om te geloven in haar dansdromen, maar tussen droom en daad staan praktische bezwaren.

Isabel is nog te jong om op zichzelf te wonen, maar ze heeft ook nog geen recht op een OV-studentenkaart. De reiskosten van het openbaar vervoer van € 427,- per maand zijn voor ons een enorme kostenpost  om op te brengen naast de aanvullende kosten die een dansopleiding toch al met zich mee brengen.


De Campagne

Deze crowdfunding is een klein kunstproject geworden. Twee getalenteerde jonge kunstenaars geloven net als wij in de droom van Isabel. Zij hebben haar droom vastgelegd in bijzonder beeldmateriaal. Als tegenprestatie voor uw donatie ontvangt u exclusieve gesigneerde foto‘s van Isabel die in een industriële achtergrond bij de voormalige steenfabriek in Wijk bij Duurstede zijn genomen. Hoe groter uw bijdrage hoe meer keuzevrijheid u heeft en hoe artistieker de foto ’s worden.

We vragen een bijdrage in de studiekosten van Isabel. De grootste kostenpost; het openbaar vervoer, dagelijks van Wijk bij Duurstede naar Rotterdam, wordt steeds hoger. Ons totale doel is € 4.270,-. We hebben bij Indigogo gekozen voor de flexibele variant van fundraising, zodat elke bijdrage behouden blijft ook als we het einddoel niet bereiken. Eventuele extra bijdragen worden gebruikt voor Isabel haar dansopleiding; bijvoorbeeld, dansschoenen en extra balletlessen en workshops.


Steun deze getalenteerde 15 jarige danseres door een donatie naar uw keuze!! Kies een van de Perks en ontvang één of meer gesigneerde foto’s (voorbeelden onderaan deze pagina).


Andere manieren om te helpen

We begrijpen dat niet iedereen kan of wil doneren. Toch kunt u wel Isabel helpen door ruchtbaarheid aan haar campagne te geven. Gebruik de Indigogo knop, deel het op Facebook, Twitter, email of andere vorm van sociale media. Deel dit bericht met vrienden en familie of iemand anders die kan helpen om de droom van deze getalenteerde, jonge hardwerkende danseres te vervullen.

Ook kunt u ons en andere getalenteerde dansers helpen om de petitie voor OV reismogelijkheid voor DAMU studenten te ondertekenen, zodat wellicht de overheid in de toekomst zorg draagt voor reismogelijkheden voor studenten op de opleiding Muziek en dans. Petities voor-ov-kaart

Hartelijk dank voor uw bijdrage!

Jacqueline Copray en Arend Kooring




Isabel’s Story  (English translation)

"When I’m dancing, deeply concentrated, then I’ am different. Then… I dance my own story in a different world…, so strange!"


Isabel is four years old when she makes her first dance moves in her pink tights and leotard. From that moment on her days are filled with dance and ballet. Now, almost twelve years later, there is happiness but also a deeper desire to dance professionally one day.

Isabel is 15 years old and in the third year of HAVO/VWO for Music and Dance (HMD) Codarts in Rotterdam. In addition to her regular courses, she follows at least 20 hours of dance lessons per week. She works long days and so far, has travelled 3.5 times around the world by bus and train to her dance training already. And this is just the beginning.

Every morning at half past seven Isabel gets on the bus. That’s the beginning of her one and a half hour daily journey to Rotterdam. She works hard for her big dream every day!

Where many little ballerinas eventually cut up their tutu into a party accessory, Isabel remained dedicated to her dream. As her ideals seem to be more and more within reach, the more she is determined to carry on this path. Whatever it takes, she continues to grow as a dancer, like her dream does!

Isabel’s ambition is to be part of her role model one day; the Dutch Dance Theatre (Nederlands Dans Theater (NDT)). Isabel has fallen in love with the combination of modern / contemporary dance and classical ballet of this company. It gives her the feeling that you can change things with art and enrich the world.

Serious dance students should also use their summers wisely, and don't just enjoy a laid back summer! Isabel wants to work at her dancing career and follows a Summer School. There she improves her skills and strength and  makes new contacts in the dance world. It is an enormous enrichment to train a few weeks with other motivated young dancers led by inspiring professionals. This summer Isabel has been selected for a Summer School Course for 2 weeks at the "Dutch Don't Dance Division”.

To believe in her dance dreams is a challenge. However, there are all kinds of obstacles on her way. Between dream and reality there are some practical obstacles.

Isabel is still too young to live on her own and she is not entitled to a public transport student pass till the age of 18. Raising the increasing travel expenses of   € 427, - per month is getting more and more difficult for her family.


The Campaign Breakdown

This crowdfunding has become a small Art project. Two talented young artists believe in Isabel’s dream just as we do. They have transformed her dream into special and unique footage. In return for your donation you'll receive exclusively autographed pictures of Isabel taken in a contrasting industrial atmosphere at the former brickworks in Wijk bij Duurstede. The more generous your contribution, the more choice you have in these pictures.

We are crowdfunding for the increasing costs of Isabel’s dance study, travel expenses in particular. Our goal is to raise €4.270,- We have chosen for the flexible variant of fundraising by Indigogo, so every contribution will be used completely even if we don’t achieve the ultimate goal. Extra contribution funds will go to Isabel’s dancing study; for instance extra tuition (Classical Ballet at a RAD School, workshops) and gear for Isabel's dance.


Support this 15 year old talented girl with a perk and receive one or more signed photographs! (Examples down this page).


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is able or willing to donate. However you can help Isabel by making some “noise’’  about her campaign. Share! Spread the word! Use the Indigogo “share” tools. Sharing her Indigogo page on Facebook, Twitter, email or any other type of social media. Tell friends and family or anyone who may want to fund a talented, young, hardworking dancer to achieve her dream.

You can also help us and other talented Dutch dancers to sign the petition for public transportation for students following a Music and Dance education. So hopefully our government will contribute in travel expenses for these students in the future. Petities voor-ov-kaart


Thank you for your help!

Jacqueline Copray & Arend Kooring


Photos by:  Sven Signe den Hartog

Movie by:    Edwin van der Sande

Locations:  Bosscherwaarden  -  googlemaps/@51.961606,5.31862

                       Calypsotheater  -  googlemaps/@51.973,5.345345

                       Codarts  -  googlemaps/@51.921786,4.470863

HMD:            Havo VWO voor Muziek en Dans

Codarts:      Codarts

NDT:             Nederlands Dans Theater

DDDDD:       De Dutch Don't Dance Division


Perks


€5  Dance is a Miracle

With € 5 or more you will receive a thank you email message featuring a dance photo of Isabel (example below). And we will keep you informed about her progress in dance.

Als je Isabel' s dans droom met € 5,- steunt ontvang je een bedankje via email met een dans foto van Isabel. En we houden je op de hoogte van haar ontwikkelingen op dansgebied.


€25  The joy of Dance

If you support Isabel's dancing dream with € 25,- or more you will receive two personalized dance photo’s (example below) of 13x19 cm (approximately 5x7 inch), and we will keep you informed about her progress in dance.

Als je Isabel' s dans droom met € 25,- steunt ontvang je twee gepersonaliseerde dans foto’ s (zie voorbeeld hieronder) van 13x19 cm. En we houden je op de hoogte van haar ontwikkelingen op dansgebied.

2 personalized dance photo's

 



€75  Practice means to Perform

If you support Isabel's dancing dream with € 75,- you will receive two personalized dance photos and you may choose one additional set of extra pictures; Dance 1 or Dance 2  (example below) of 13x19 cm (approximately 5x7 inch). And we will keep you informed about her progress in dance.

Als je Isabel' s dans droom met € 75,- steunt ontvang je twee gepersonaliseerde dans foto’s en je mag een keuze maken uit 1 van de 2 sets van Dansfoto’s; Dance 1 of Dance 2 (zie voorbeeld hieronder) van 13x19 cm.  En we houden je op de hoogte van haar ontwikkelingen op dansgebied.

Dance 1

      

Dance 2

      


€125  The body tells the Story

If you support Isabel's dancing dream with € 125,- you will receive two personalized dance photos and you may choose one additional set of extra pictures; Dance 1, Dance 2 or Water (examples) of 13x19 cm (approximately 5x7 inch). And we will keep you informed about her progress in dance.

Als je Isabel' s dans droom met € 125,- steunt ontvang je twee gepersonaliseerde dans foto’s en  je mag een keuze maken uit 1 van de 3 sets van dansfoto’s; Dance 1, Dance 2 of Water (zie voorbeelden) van 13x19 cm. En houden we je op de hoogte van haar ontwikkelingen op dansgebied.

Water

           

  


€250 Great because of Passion

If you support Isabel's dancing dream with € 250, - you receive two personalized dance photos and you make a choice of 2 of the 4 sets Dance Photos; Dance 1 Dance 2, water or Pointes (see examples) of 13x19 cm (approximately 5x7 inch). And we will keep you informed of developments in her dancing.

Als je Isabel' s dans droom met € 250,- steunt ontvang je twee gepersonaliseerde dans foto’s en je mag een keuze maken uit 2 van de 4 sets van Dansfoto’s; Dance 1, Dance 2, Water of Pointes (zie voorbeelden) van 13x19 cm. En houden we je op de hoogte van haar ontwikkelingen op dansgebied.

Pointes

  

  


€500  Beyond my Dream

If you support Isabel's dancing dream with € 500, - you will receive two personalized dance photos and Artistic pictures below. You may choose from 2 of the 4 sets of dance photos; Dance 1, Dance 2, Water or Pointes (see examples) of 13x19 cm (approximately 5x7 inch). And we will keep you informed of developments in her dancing.

Als je Isabel' s dans droom met € 500,- steunt ontvang je twee gepersonaliseerde dans foto’s en de artistieke foto’s hieronder. Tevens mag je een keuze maken uit 2 van de 4 sets van Dansfoto’s; Dance 1,  Dance 2, Water of Pointes (zie voorbeeld hieronder) van 13x19 cm. En houden we je op de hoogte van haar ontwikkelingen op dansgebied. 

Artistic

       

  

Estimated delivery of photos: July 2015

en verrijken in de wereld.

verstandig gebruiken en niet alleen genieten van een ontspannen zomervakantie!  Isabel wil werken aan haar danscarrière en
volgt  een ‘Summer School’.  Daar verbetert ze haar vaardigheden en
kracht, en maakt ze nieuwe contacten in de danswereld. Het is een enorme
verrijking om een paar weken met andere gemotiveerde jonge dansers te trainen
onder leiding van inspirerende professionals. Deze zomer is Isabel geselecteerd
voor een Summer School van 2 weken bij de Dutch Don’t Dance Divison.
Het is uitdagend
om te geloven in haar dansdromen, maar tussen droom en daad staan praktische
bezwaren.
Isabel is nog te jong om op zichzelf te wonen, maar ze
heeft ook nog geen recht op een OV-studentenkaart. De reiskosten van het
openbaar vervoer van € 427,- per maand zijn voor ons een enorme kostenpost  om op te brengen naast de aanvullende kosten
die een dansopleiding toch al met zich mee brengen. 

De Campagne
Deze crowdfunding is een klein kunstproject geworden.
Twee getalenteerde jonge kunstenaars geloven net als wij in de droom van
Isabel. Zij hebben haar droom vastgelegd in bijzonder beeldmateriaal. Als
tegenprestatie voor uw donatie ontvangt u exclusieve gesigneerde foto‘s van
Isabel die in een industriële achtergrond bij de voormalige steenfabriek in
Wijk bij Duurstede zijn genomen. Hoe groter uw bijdrage hoe meer keuzevrijheid u
heeft en hoe artistieker de foto ’s worden.
We vragen
een bijdrage in de studiekosten van Isabel. De grootste kostenpost; het
openbaar vervoer, dagelijks van Wijk bij Duurstede naar Rotterdam, wordt steeds
hoger. Ons totale doel is € 4.270,-. We hebben
bij Indigogo gekozen voor de flexibele variant van fundraising, zodat elke
bijdrage behouden blijft ook als we het einddoel niet bereiken. Eventuele extra bijdragen worden
gebruikt voor Isabel haar dansopleiding; bijvoorbeeld, dansschoenen en extra
balletlessen en workshops.

Steun deze getalenteerde 15
jarige danseres door een donatie naar uw keuze!! Kies een van de Perks en ontvang één of meer
gesigneerde foto’s (voorbeelden onderaan deze pagina).

Andere manieren om te helpen
We
begrijpen dat niet iedereen kan of wil doneren. Toch kunt u wel Isabel helpen
door ruchtbaarheid aan haar campagne te geven. Gebruik de Indigogo knop, deel
het op Facebook, Twitter, email of andere vorm van sociale media. Deel dit
bericht met vrienden en familie of iemand anders die kan helpen om de droom van
deze getalenteerde, jonge hardwerkende danseres te vervullen. 
Ook kunt
u ons en andere getalenteerde dansers helpen om de petitie voor OV
reismogelijkheid voor DAMU studenten te ondertekenen, zodat wellicht de
overheid in de toekomst zorg draagt voor reismogelijkheden voor studenten op de
opleiding Muziek en dans. Petities voor-ov-kaart
Hartelijk dank voor uw bijdrage!
Jacqueline Copray en Arend
Kooring
Isabel’s Story 
(English translation)
"When I’m dancing, deeply concentrated, then I’ am different. Then… I dance my own story in a different world…, so strange!"



Isabel is four years old when she makes her first dance moves in her pink tights and
leotard. From that moment on her days are filled with dance and ballet. Now,
almost twelve years later, there is happiness but also a deeper desire to dance
professionally one day.

Isabel is 15 years old and in the third year of HAVO/VWO for Music and Dance (HMD) Codarts in Rotterdam.
In addition to her regular courses, she follows at least 20 hours of dance
lessons per week. She works long days and so far, has travelled 3.5 times
around the world by bus and train to her dance training already. And this is
just the beginning.
Every morning at half past seven Isabel gets on the bus. That’s the beginning of her
one and a half hour daily journey to Rotterdam. She works hard for her big dream every day!
Where many little ballerinas eventually cut up their tutu into a party accessory,
Isabel remained dedicated to her dream. As her ideals seem to be more and more
within reach, the more she is determined to carry on this path. Whatever it
takes, she continues to grow as a dancer, like her dream does!
Isabel’s ambition is to be part of her role model one day; the Dutch Dance Theatre (Nederlands Dans Theater (NDT)). Isabel has fallen in love with the combination
of modern / contemporary dance and classical ballet of this company. It gives
her the feeling that you can change things with art and enrich the world.
Serious
dance students should also use their summers wisely, and don't just enjoy a laid
back summer! Isabel wants to work at her dancing career and follows a Summer
School. There she improves her skills and strength and  makes new contacts in the dance world. It is
an enormous enrichment to train a few weeks with other motivated young dancers
led by inspiring professionals. This summer Isabel has been selected for a
Summer School Course for 2 weeks at the "Dutch Don't Dance Division”.
To
believe in her dance dreams is a challenge. However, there are all kinds of obstacles
on her way. Between dream and reality there are some practical obstacles.
Isabel
is still too young to live on her own and she is not entitled to a public
transport student pass till the age of 18. Raising the increasing travel
expenses of   € 427, - per month is getting more and more difficult for her
family.

The
Campaign Breakdown
This crowdfunding has become a small Art project.
Two talented young artists believe in Isabel’s dream just as we do. They have
transformed her dream into special and unique footage. In return for your
donation you'll receive exclusively autographed pictures of Isabel taken in a contrasting
industrial atmosphere at the former brickworks in Wijk bij Duurstede. The more
generous your contribution, the more choice you have in these pictures.
We
are crowdfunding for the increasing costs of Isabel’s dance study, travel expenses
in particular. Our goal is to raise €4.270,- We have chosen for the flexible variant of
fundraising by Indigogo, so every contribution will be used completely even if
we don’t achieve the ultimate goal. Extra contribution funds will go to Isabel’s
dancing study; for instance extra tuition (Classical Ballet at a RAD School,
workshops) and gear for Isabel's dance. 

Support this 15 year old talented girl with a perk and receive one or more signed photographs! (Examples down this page).

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand not everyone is able or willing to
donate. However you can help Isabel by making some “noise’’  about her campaign. Share! Spread the word! Use
the Indigogo “share” tools. Sharing her Indigogo page on Facebook,
Twitter, email or any other type of social media. Tell friends and family or
anyone who may want to fund a talented, young, hardworking dancer to achieve her
dream.
You
can also help us and other talented Dutch dancers to sign the petition for
public transportation for students following a Music and Dance education. So hopefully
our government will contribute in travel expenses for these students in the future. Petities voor-ov-kaart

Thank you for your help! 
Jacqueline Copray &
Arend Kooring

story:
View our Website and get involved!

www.bloodspeaks.com


What is 'Blood Speaks'? 

Blood Speaks is a stage production for the whole family, dynamically incorporating multimedia, mass choirs, dances and drama! Focused on the powerful message of forgiveness and reconciliation, it's a huge community project with hundreds of people from surrounding areas taking part. It touches on some historical events such as the Armenian Genocide, Pope Gregory, and the World Wars.

In 2013, it was performed for the first time, with an amazing response from the crowds. The follow up production in 2014 was also packed! 

Now, in 2015 - we are going even BIGGER! On 9, 10 & 11 April, it will be performed in the SAND DU PLESSIS THEATER which, by the way, is the biggest theater in the Free State. With this, we hope to impact 3000 people in three nights! 

Along with this, Blood Speaks is going to every province in South Africa! A team of 12 passionate people (cast and crew) are hitting the road with a NATIONWIDE BLOOD SPEAKS TOUR!   

TOUR DATES

Term 1 (January - March): Free State and Northern Cape
Term 2 (April - June): Gauteng
Term 3 (July- September): Mpumalanga, North West and Limpopo
Term 4 (October - December): Kwa-Zulu Natal, Western and Eastern Cape


Community Impact

What makes this project really special is that the surrounding community will be involved and trained. Volunteers from schools, churches and disadvantaged rural communities in every town will be trained for choirs, dances and dramas. Training these communities has already begun!

(ABOVE: Boitumelo & Nicolette from the Spear Points project preparing pumpkins for the children at Blood Speaks practice to take home to their families.) 

Blood Speaks will be working alongside the Spear Points Project to empower and involve the disadvantaged rural community in areas surrounding Bloemfontein: The money we raise here will not be for profit at all, but every cent will be put towards taking the production to the people.

TO MAKE 2015 POSSIBLE- WE NEED YOU!


What We Need & What You Get

While most of the cost of the performance in the Sand du Plessis Theater will be covered by ticket sales, we are running this campaign to raise the bare minimum needed to make the tour possible. It is a HUGE project with many costs involved- and we need YOUR HELP!

COSTS WE HOPE TO COVER:

  • FUEL: About $2000 per month (3 vehicles traveling throughout South Africa). This is for transportation of the team and for local participants (adults and children) from surrounding communities to and from the event.
  • Production groundwork in every town
  • Production expenses (renting venues, lights, electrical: about $700 per month: About $8400 for the year
  • A high definition projector for the bigger venues
  • Vehicles (1 pickup truck and 2-3 cars- enough to transport our equipment and 12 people)
  • Performance fees for the cast and crew
  • Traveling gear for 12 people
  • General maintenance: about $500 per month ($6000 for the year)

WE KNOW OUR CAMPAIGN AMOUNT IS NOT ENOUGH, BUT WE HOPE TO RAISE ENOUGH TO COVER AT LEAST SOME ASPECTS- WHATEVER WE RAISE OVER AND ABOVE THE CAMPAIGN AMOUNT WILL GO DIRECTLY INTO THE REST OF EVERYTHING MENTIONED ABOVE!


OUR GIFTS TO YOU

  • In return for your generosity, we have some awesome perks for you- complimentary tickets,  T-shirts, DVD's, great personal gifts and more! PLUS you also become part of spreading the message of forgiveness in a country where this is so needed!

Other Ways You Can Get Involved

We know that some of you think you can't contribute and we get that- but there are other ways you can be involved: 

  • COME WATCH THE SHOW! The performance schedule will be up on the website in 2015- come share in the awesome experience!
  • SPREAD THE WORD! Ask people around you to make some noise about this campaign on Indiegogo- share the link on Facebook, Twitter, or email people! At the bottom of this page, there are share tools! SHARE SHARE SHARE with your friends and enemies!
  • CONTACT US to let us know if we should be speaking to other people you may think would like to contribute.
  • TEAM UP! We know not everyone has Paypal or a Credit Card (especially the students and scholars involved in the production). You can find a friend who does have access to these methods of payment and make a group effort!
  • DONATE ANYTHING! We won't feel like your younger brother- We appreciate "hand-me-downs"! Any kind, in any form, color or texture, even edible ones! So, if it is a tube of toothpaste, a year's supply of baked beans or your granny's old car, thank-you, we'll take it!
  • MONTHLY Lastly, if you would like to give a monthly contribution throughout the year, please contact us a soon as possible!
Thank you so much for taking the time to read this! Please go to the donate button and click on it!!! 

LASTLY- If you were wondering WHY we are doing this, here it is: 

South Africa is in a critical time: 20 years post apartheid, but still repercussions of the past can be seen. South Africa needs this message. The positive impact it made in the lives of people and the feedback we received from the 2013 and 2014 shows was overwhelming! Building a better future is something people believe in, and also what we as a team believe in. 

Blood Speaks touches on events in history, and how we can interpret them- coming back to the central message of forgiveness. 

2015 also marks the 100 year anniversary of the Armenian Genocide - the world will have something to say.

Hitler's interpretation of history led to an even more “bloody” history in WORLD WAR II. He manipulated and motivated Germany to kill millions of Jews by referring back to the Armenian tragedy with the fact that the world did nothing when that happened, saying: “Who after all, speaks today of the annihilation of the Armenians?” 

Factual history in Blood Speaks encourages the audience to choose wisely between the two lines of thought – to build or to destroy.

The production is neither politically motivated, nor about the genocide, nor a documentary, but uses these events to bring awareness of our “bloody” past, present and (if we don’t change) the future. It points to the blood of Jesus Christ as the ultimate example of forgiveness.

story:
About Us

Curtain Calls Theater Group was founded in an effort to address what we felt was a need in our community. Theater for children is very hard to find in our school district at the elementary school district. Since 2011, we have strived to bring theater to the elementary school level. We started out with the Wizard of Oz and have added shows such as Alice in Wonderland, The Trials of Robin Hood and The Grimm Brothers Spectaculathon. Each of our shows is run by our students, from the bottom to the top. Our students run the sound, lighting and  help design the sets and costumes. All to often children theater gets a bum rap. It brings visions of paper costumes and kids with their lines in their hands. This is the negative stereotype that our kids were meant to disprove. We put our trust in our kids and they definitely produce. Nothing like a ten year old learning 300 plus lines and playing to a packed house to show people what kids can do! 

Our programs were so well received that we expanded out to a nearby middle school as well, further expanding our ability to introduce theater. This is strictly a volunteer operation. One hundred percent of our raised funds goes back into the program to enrich these students lives. To date over 500 students have passed through our programs and experienced the joys of the stage. 

www.curtaincallstheater.com

Funding Children's Dreams

What we need is help funding our shows. Theater is incredibly expensive at all levels, Rights to a show, sets, costumes, props, site fees all eat into a budget that we fund ourselves. Our goal, or any contributions we are able to attain, will help us to offset some of the costs of the production to create a memorable experience. Since we are not funded from an outside agency, the burden falls to us to raise the funds to procure all the necessary elements to put on a show. 

The Impact

Why is this important anyway? I mean it is all well and good for kids to enjoy theater, however in the grand scheme of things is it really the important. Definitely! Theater helps children develop an amazing amount of skills that will give them a jump in their lives. Dedication, collaboration, perseverance, the art of receiving constructive criticism, creativity, confidence and accountability are just some of the things that children can learn when involved in theater. These are attributes that we all use everyday and learning them at an early age can truly help our youth! 

Here is an article with some more information on the subject,


http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/answer-sheet/wp/2013/01/22/top-10-skills-children-learn-from-the-arts/


Other Ways You Can Help

This isn't just about raising money for this show, it is also about raising awareness for the importance of theater for today's youth. Even if you can not contribute, spread the word! Help us get the message out there!

  • Please spread the word and get some noise going about this campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!
  • Please "Like" us on Facebook and follow our updates! https://www.facebook.com/trantwood.troupers
    • Also "Follow" us on Twitter!  
    • https://twitter.com/trouperstheater
    • For more info on the show or our groups, visit our website, www.curtaincallstheater.com

    Feel free to re-post this to all other social networking sites - the more who view, the better! 

    THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!  We are so very grateful for anything you can do!

story:
“We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize truth at least the truth that is given us to understand.”

― Pablo Picasso

Support new, original theatre that crosses genre and medium boundaries.

The Art is a Lie  is a theatrical experience that explores the interconnectedness of all art forms. This is a series of short plays that will be staged in an art gallery venue during the KC Fringe. They explore a variety of topics and different facets of the theme, from creating art to experiencing it. This is the first of (hopefully with your assistance) many productions we will produce that cross or ignore medium boundaries altogether.

The show grapples with immediate, contemporary issues, such as abuse culture and domestic abuse, love and relationships in a time of technology, commercialism, self-destruction, and of course the ultimate question…What is art? There also may or may not be an art heist involved. Shhhhh. It’s top secret.

Support paying artists for their work.

The funds will go to paying fringe entry fees, marketing and publicity efforts, and getting rehearsal spaces, but mostly toward having enough funds to pay the brilliant actors, artists, and technical crew who are working on this show. Artists deserve to be paid for the work they do and we want to be able to pay the brilliant artists working with us.

The Art is a Lie  will feature work from playwrights Margaret Shelby, Lindsay Adams, and Victor Wishna. It will be directed by Katie Lee and Elizabeth Bettendorf Bowman. This is an opportunity to help a fledgling company produce the first of what we hope will be a series of genre and medium bending productions.

Why do it through theatre? 

We believe that when done right, theatre is a powerful tool in making people truly listen and explore topics that are difficult or controversial. So please, support new voices in the theatre, female playwrights and directors, and staging productions in non-traditional spaces!
