story:
“Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ - Plateia Omonoias -Concord” is a site specific physical theatre performance, selected to be a part of the In Progress Feedback Festival (recognized by the EFFE International Jury as one of Europe’s finest festivals) in Athens. “Concord” is an international collaboration between Greek, Indian and Lithuanian artists, hosted and coordinated by us, an Athens based theatre group called Simmoria tou iliou (Gang of the Sun).

This physical theatre performance will take place at Omonia square (Omonia means ‘unity’ in Greek), a busy street in Athens where we will explore meetings in urban spaces, hoping to offer joy, love and hope in these conflict and despair ridden times.
 Even though In Progress Feedback Festival provides us with the fantastic opportunity to perform in public spaces in Athens, yet it is unable to provide any financial support. Our project, would not be possible without monetary aid as this is a free for all public art project, a non commercial venture. We seek your assistance to help us put together a performance that is not for a select few but attempts to create a joyous surprise and a sense of community for all passers by at the city square.
* ΟΙ ΕΛΛΗΝΕΣ ΚΑΤΑΘΕΤΕΣ ΠΑΡΑΚΑΛΟΥΜΕ ΔΕΙΤΕ ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ ΚΑΤΑΘΕΣΗΣ ΣΤΟ ΤΕΛΟΣ ΤΗΣ ΣΕΛΙΔΑΣ.

To “Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ - Plateia Omonoias -Concord” είναι μια site specific performance σωματικού θεάτρου, η οποία επιλέχτηκε να παρουσιαστεί στα πλαίσια του In Progress Feedback Festival (αναγνωρισμένο από τη Διεθνή Κριτική Επιτροπή EFFE ως ένα από τα καλύτερα φεστιβάλ της Ευρώπης), στην Αθήνα. Πρόκειται για μια συνεργασία καλλιτεχνών από Ελλάδα, Ινδία και Λιθουανία η οποία οργανώνεται και φιλοξενείται από μια θεατρική ομάδα με έδρα την Αθήνα, τη Συμμορία του Ήλιου.

Αυτή η παράσταση σωματικού θεάτρου θα γίνει στην Πλατεία Ομονοίας όπου και θα εξερευνήσει την έννοια των συναντήσεων στον αστικό χώρο, ελπίζοντας να προσφέρει αγάπη και ελπίδα σε μια εποχή που τείνει να επικρατεί η σύγκρουση και η απελπισία.

Παρόλο που το In Progress Feedback Festival μας προσφέρει αυτή την φανταστική ευκαιρία του να παίξουμε σε δημόσιους χώρους της Αθήνας δεν έχει τη δυνατότητα να μας προσφέρει καμία οικονομική υποστήριξη. Το project μας δεν θα μπορέσει να πραγματοποιηθεί χωρίς κάποια χρηματική συμβολή, καθώς πρόκειται για ένα καλλιτεχνικό project που ελεύθερα μπορεί να το παρακολουθήσει κανείς. Ζητάμε λοιπόν τη βοήθειά σας για να καταφέρουμε να συνθέσουμε αυτή την παράσταση που δεν θα είναι για λίγους, αλλά θα επιχειρήσει να φέρει χαρά, έκπληξη και μια αίσθηση ενότητας σε όσους περνούν από την πλατεία της πόλης.


Our Concept:

This year the theme of the In Progress Feedback Festival is ‘Urban Surprises’. We have chosen Omonia Square for our performance with the aim of creating a performance that explores playfulness and acceptance of diversity in a busy public place. Our objective is to revive, invoke and play games that we used to as children. We were inspired by the history of this particular square as it is an iconic Athenian square that used to be a very popular meeting point for the people of Athens. Of late, however, a lot of people avoid crossing the square due to fear of encountering homeless people and drug addicts. Games that we used to play as children on the streets become the pivotal point to explore meetings in urban areas and communication with strangers we inhabit the same space with but seldom communicate joyously and fearlessly with.

Η ιδέα μας:

Αυτή τη χρονιά το θέμα του In Progress Feedback Festival είναι οι ' Αστικές Εκπλήξεις'. Διαλέξαμε την πλατεία Ομονοίας για το project μας με σκοπό να δημιουργήσουμε μια παράσταση που θα εξερευνά την ανάγκη μας για παιχνίδι και την αποδοχή της διαφορετικότητας σε ένα πολυσύχναστοδημόσιο χώρο. Σκοπεύουμε να ανασύρουμε, να θυμηθούμε και να παίξουμε τα παιχνίδια που συνηθίζαμε ως παιδιά. Εμπνευστήκαμε από την ιστορία της συγκεκριμένης πλατείας, καθώς ήταν μια πλατεία των Αθηνών που χρησιμοποιούνταν ως σημείο συνάντησης των κατοίκων της πόλης. Τα τελευταία χρόνια, πολύς κόσμος την αποφεύγει από φόβο συνάντησης με χρήστες ναρκωτικών ή αστέγων. Παιχνίδια που συνηθίζαμε να παίζουμε ως παιδιά στους δρόμους γίνονται ο κεντρικός άξονας από τον οποίο θα εξερευνήσουμε τις συναντήσεις στις αστικές περιοχές και την επικοινωνία με αγνώστους με τους οποίους μοιραζόμαστε τον ίδιο χώρο αλλά σπάνια επικοινωνούμε με χαρά και δίχως φόβο μαζί τους.

The traffic light turns red; 

a cacophony of rushing feet. 

We catch the corner of each other's eyes, 

we don't stop and greet.

Avoid physical contact carefully 

My crisp white shirt 

Mustn't get tarnished 

By your bohemian ideology. 

I haven't heard of the name 

Of the town you were born in. 

If only, I had asked you of the game

You played as a child, down your alley. 

Truth be told, we’re scared we might find 

That a smile can travel far,

And there is so much to unite us strangers 

Who on first glance, 

thought they were most unlike each other. 


~by Manjari Kaul, the codirector of Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ Plateia Omonoias Concord


Το φανάρι γίνεται κόκινο;

μια κακοφωνία απο βιαστικά πόδια .

Πιάνουμε ο ένας την ακρη του ματιού του άλλου,

δεν σταματάμε να χαιρετήσουμε.

Αποφεύγουμε την σωματική επαφή προσεκτικά

Το κάτασπρο πουκάμισό μου

Δεν πρέπει να λερώσει απο την μποέμ ιδεολογία σου

Δεν έχω ξανακούσει αυτό το όνομα

Της πόλης που έχεις γεννηθεί

Έτσι και σε είχα ρωτήσει για το παιχνίδι

που έπαιξες ως παιδί, στη γειτονιά σου.

Η αλήθεια να λέγεται, φοβόμαστε πως ίσως και να βρίσκαμε

πως ένα χαμόγελο μπορεί να ταξιδέψει πολύμακριά

και πως είναι τόσα πολλά αυτά που μας ενώνουν εμάς τους ξένους

που με την πρώτη ματιά

νομίσαμε πως ήμασταν τόσο διαφορετικοί.


~απο την Manjari Kaul, μια απο τις δυο σκηνοθέτες του Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ Plateia Omonoias Concord


The project is hosted and coordinated by Athens based theatre group Simmoria tou iliou, established by Melina Skoufou in 2012. The play “Eviva!”,  is  the company's most recent success . Traveling together in the same train, two Greek women one of our own troubled  times and another one of the same age, having lived the tough times of the German occupation in Greece. They meet. A journey through their memories with fast motion, humor and emotion, which was performed for two years in a well known theater in Athens.

Το project οργανώνει και φιλοξενεί η ομάδα "Συμμορία του Ήλιου" που έχει έδρα την Αθήνα και έχει ιδρυθεί το 2012 απο τη Μελίνα Σκούφου.  Το έργο "Εβίβα!" είναι η πιο πρόσφατη επιτυχία της ομάδας . Συνταξιδιώτισσες στο ίδιο βαγόνι, "συναντιούνται" μία νεαρή κοπέλα της δικής μας ταραγμένης εποχής και μια συνομήλική της, από τα δύσκολα χρόνια της γερμανικής κατοχής στην Ελλάδα. Ένα ταξίδι ζωής στις αναμνήσεις των δύο γυναικών με πολύ γρήγορους ρυθμούς, συγκίνηση και χιούμορ, που παρουσιάστηκε για δύο χρονιές σε γνωστό θέατρο της Αθήνας.


Our Team:

CoDirectors: Melina Skoufou and Manjari Kaul

Assistant Director: Victoria Papamichail

Choreography: Giedre Degutyte
Costume and Prop Designer: Georgia Bourda

Music Composer: Andreas Skoufos Photos-Cinematography: Giorgos Voursouki

Performers: Giedre Degutyte, Manjari Kaul, Victoria Papamichail, Melina Skoufou, Eva Tsourou

Η Ομάδα:

Σκηνοθέτες: Μελίνα Σκούφου, Manjari Kaul

Βοηθός Σκηνοθέτη: Βικτώρια Παπαμιχαήλ

Χορογραφία: Giedre Dequtyte

Κουστούμια-Αντικείμενα: Γεωργια Μπούρδα

Μουσική σύνθεση: Ανδρέας Σκούφος

Φωτογραφία-Κινηματογράφηση: Γιώργος Βουρσούκης

Performers: Giedre Degutyte, Manjari Kaul, Βικτώρια Παπαμιχαήλ, Μελίνα Σκούφου, Εύα Τσούρου

Melina Skoufou

Melina is a performer and a director, based in Athens. Studied Acting and Directing at the University of Peloponnese. In July 2012 she established "Simmoria tou iliou" (Gang of the Sun), a group for research in the Arts. She has worked as an assistant director in various productions and theatre in Athens, Cyprus and Germany and has the experience of running theatre sessions in mental health centres. As a painter she has done two exhibitions in Athens and Nafplio. She trained at The Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre in Athens in autumn, 2015. For more information on Melina’s theatre group: http://www.symmoriatouiliou.com/

https://www.facebook.com/evivaa/

Μελίνα Σκούφου

Η Μελίνα είναι performer και σκηνοθέτης. Σπούδασε στο Πανεπιστήμιο της Πελοποννήσου. Τον Ιούλιο του 2012 ίδρυσε τη Συμμορία του Ήλιου, μια ομάδα για έρευνα στις τέχνες. Έχει δουλέψει ως βοηθός σκηνοθέτη σε παραγωγές και διάφορα θέατρα της Αθήνας, της Κύπρου και της Γερμανίας και έχει εμπειρία συντονισμού ομάδων σε ιδρύματα ψυχικά ασθενών. Έχει κάνει δυο εκθέσεις ζωγραφικής στην Αθήνα και το Ναύπλιο. Εκπαιδεύτηκε επίσης στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre το φθινόπωρο του 2015 στην Αθήνα. Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με τη δουλειά της Μελίνας:

http://www.symmoriatouiliou.com

https://www.facebook.com/evivaa/

Manjari Kaul

Manjari is an artist at DUENDE and a performer/ theatre director and Arts Writer, based in India. She trained at the Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre in Athens in autumn, 2015. In 2014, she premiered her solo show, Chronicle of a Death Foretold, an adaptation of Gabriel Garcia Marquez's novel at The Delhi International Arts Festival and which has since travelled to Lucknow and Bangalore as well. She works extensively with children, engaging them in understanding their own bodies to communicate, learn and comprehend real and imagined worlds. For more information on Manjari’s work: https://www.facebook.com/improperfractionstheatre/ and https://manjarikaul.wordpress.com/category/performance/

Manjari Kaul

Η Manjari είναι μια απο τους καλλιτέχνες των DUENDE και μια performer, σκηνοθέτης και συγγραφέας Τεχνών, με έδρα την Ινδία. Εκπαιδεύτηκε στο Duende School Of Ensemble Physical Theatre το φθινόπωρο του 2015 στην Αθήνα. Το 2014 παρουσίασε για πρώτη φορά τη σόλο παράστασή της, Το χρονικό ενός προαναγγελθέντος θανάτου, μια διασκευή του διηγήματος του Gabriel Garcia Marquez's, στο 'The Delhi International Arts Festival' και απο τότε έχει παρουσιαστεί επίσης στο Lucknow and Bangalore. Δουλεύει εκτεταμένα με παιδιά προσπαθώντας να τους ενισχύσει την κατανόηση του σώματός τους ως μέσω επικοινωνίας, μάθησης και αντίληψης αληθινών και φανταστικών κόσμων. Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με τη δουλειά της Manjari:

https://www.facebook.com/improperfractionstheatre/ and https://manjarikaul.wordpress.com/category/performance/

Victoria Papamichail

Victoria lives and works in Thessaloniki, in Northern Greece. She studied Psychophysical Acting and Improvisation and has been involved in playback theatre, an interactive form of improvisation through storytelling, for over a decade. She trained at the Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre in Athens in autumn 2015.

Βικτώρια Παπαμιχαήλ

Η Βικτώρια ζει και εργάζεται στην Θεσσαλονίκη, στη βόρεια Ελλάδα. Σπούδασε Psychophysical Τheatre και Αυτοσχεδιασμό και έχει ασχοληθεί με το θέατρο Playback, μία διαδραστική μορφή αυτοσχεδιασμού μέσω εξιστόρησης, για πάνω από μια δεκαετία. Εκπαιδεύτηκε στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre στην Αθήνα , το φθινόπωρο του 2015.

Giedre Degutyte

Giedre is a performer and circus artist from Lithuania, currently based in the UK. A Graduate in Cultural Studies at University of Leeds, she has trained in physical theatre and improvisation at the Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

For more information on Giedre’s work: http://circulardreams.weebly.com/hoop.html 

Giedre Dequtyte

Η Giedre μια performer και καλλιτέχνης του τσίρκου από τη Λιθουανία, η οποία αυτή την περίοδο ζει στην Αγγλία. Είνα απόφοιτη του τμήματος Cultural Studies του leeds Univercity UK και έχει επείσης εκπαιδευτεί στο σωματικό θέατρο και τον αυτοσχεδιασμό στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με τη δουλειά της Giedre: http://circulardreams.weebly.com/hoop.html

Eva Tsourou

Eva is a dancer and an aerial performer, based in Athens. She has worked internationally in circus and dance. She is a member of DUENDE Ensemble . Eva performs with the ensemble and teaches dance, choreography and physical skills development during company workshops and residencies. She is the main physical trainer at the DUENDE School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

Εύα Τσούρου

Η Εύα είναι χορεύτρια και εναέρια performer. Έχει δουλέψει διεθνώς στο χώρο του σωματικού θεάτρου και του τσίρκου. Είναι μέλος του DUENDE ensemble. Η Εύα παίρνει μέρος στις παραγωγές της ομάδας ως performer και διδάσκει χορό, χορογραφία και εξέλιξη της κίνησης στα residencies και τα σεμινάρια της ομάδας. Έχει επίσης αναλάβει τη διδασκαλία της σωματικής εκπαίδευσης στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

Georgia Bourda

Georgia is a set and costume designer, prop maker and set constructor, born in Thessaloniki, currently based Athens. She has worked on various theater productions in Greece and has collaborated with Simmoria tou Iliou in their theater performances and workshop. http://georgiabourda.com/

Γεωργία Μπούρδα

Η Γεωργία είναι σκηνογράφος και ενδυματολόγος. Γεννήθηκε στην Θεσαλονίκη και πλέον μένει μόνιμα στην Αθήνα. Έχει δουλέψει σε διάφορες θεατρικές παραγωγές και έχει συνεργαστεί με τη Συμμορία του Ήλιου σε διάφορες παραγωγές και σεμινάρια της ομάδας.

http://georgiabourda.com/

Andreas Skoufos

Andreas is a music composer, sound designer and drummer based in Athens. He studied Sound Engineering, Digital Audio Editing & Digital Video Editing and 3D Design & Animation. He has worked in several theatre productions in the capacity of a musician. He is also a member of the group Simmoria tou Iliou.

Αντρέας Σκούφος

Ο Αντρέας είναι μουσικός συνθέτης, sound designer και drummer με έδρα την Αθήνα. Σπούδασε Sound Engineering, Digital Audio Editing & Digital Video Editing and 3D Design & Animation.Έχει δουλέψει σε διάφορες θεατρικές παραγωγές ως μουσικός. Είναι και αυτός μέλος της Συμμορίας του Ήλιου.

Giorgos Voursoukis
Giorgos is a proffesional photographer based in Athens.
For more information about Giorgos: www.light-house.gr


Γιώργος Βουρσούκης
Ο Γιώργος είναι επαγγελματίας φωτογράφος με έδρα την Αθήνα. Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με το Γιώργο: www.light-house.gr


What We Need and What You Get:

“Concord” is a public art project that is NOT ticketed to help make it accessible to all. If you decide to contribute, your money will go towards artists’ travel expenses, their fees, production expenses like costumes, sets, music and documentation of the performance. In case we do not reach our entire goal, we may not be able to afford to have such a diverse group of collaborators. However, the project will still take place, though under a tight budget. Your support is extremely valuable and encouraging for us as it is fantastic to be able to realise a project for the community, supported by a community. To express our heartfelt gratitude to you we promise to keep you updated on the progress of the project and also send small surprises to your mailbox.

Τι χρειαζόμαστε και τι μπορείτε να μας προσφέρετε:

Το 'Concord' παρόλο που θα είναι μια δημόσια παράσταση δεν θα έχει εισιτήριο έτσι ώστε να δώσει τη δυνατότητα σε όποιον θελήσει να το παρακολουθήσει. Αν αποφασίσεις να συνεισφέρεις, τα χρήματα σου θα χρησιμοποιηθούν στα έξοδα εισιτηρίων των καλλιτεχνών, στις αμοιβές τους, σε έξοδα παραγωγής όπως σκηνικά, κουστούμια, μουσική και βιντεοσκόπηση-φωτογράφηση της παράστασης. Σε περίπτωση που δεν καταφέρουμε να φτάσουμε το χρηματικό στόχο τότε ενδεχόμενα να μην αλλάξει η σύσταση της ομάδας. Όπως και να πάντως, το project θα πραγματοποιηθεί με ένα πιο σφιχτό budjet. Η υποστήριξή σας είναι πολύτιμη και εξαιρετικά ενθαρρυντική για μας αφού είναι υπέροχο

να δημιουργείς ένα project για την κοινότητα το οποίο υποστηρίζετε από την ίδια την κοινότητα. Για να εκφράσουμε την απο καρδιάς ευγνωμοσύνη μας υποσχόμαστε να σας κρατάμε ενήμερους για την πρόοδο του project καθώς και να σας στέλνουμε έξυπνες εκπλήξεις στο mail σας.


Impact:

The aim of our public art project is to offer joy, love and hope in what are difficult times for the world (especially Greece), fraught with problems of xenophobia, racism and economic meltdown. If you contribute to the campaign, you will be contributing towards a transformation through art, momentary though it may be, of a hostile urban environment. Also, you will be helping us put together a performance that is not for a select few but attempts to create a sense of community and connection for all passers by at this Grecian city square.

Ιmpact:

Ο στόχος του δημόσιου καλλιτεχνικού μας project είναι να προσφέρουμε χαρά, αγάπη και ελπίδα σε δύσκολες εποχές σε παγκόσμιο επίπεδο, αλλά και στην Ελλάδα συγκεκριμένα, γεμάτες ξενοφοβία, ρατσισμό και οικονομική κατάρρευση. Αν συνεισφέρεις στην καμπάνια, θα συνεισφέρεις ως προς μια μεταμόρφωση μέσω της τέχνης, έστω και προσωρινής, ενός εχθρικού αστικού τοπίου. Επίσης, θα βοηθήσεις ώστε να δημιουργηθεί μια παράσταση που δεν θα είναι για λίγους αλλά που θα προσπαθήσει να δημιουργήσει μια αίσθηση κοινότητας και ενότητας για όλους τους περαστικούς αυτής της Ελληνικής πλατείας.


Other ways you can help:

If the project interests you, but you are unable to contribute money, it does not mean you cannot help. You could help us create some buzz about our campaign, get the word out on social media. Do remember to use Indiegogo share tools if you are sharing information about our campaign. And if you are Athens based, do come to watch our performance at Omonia Square in April, 2016.

Άλλοι τρόποι που μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε:

Αν σας ενδιαφέρει το project αλλά δεν μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε, αυτό δεν σημαίνει ότι δεν μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε. Μπορείτε να μας βοηθήσετε να δημιουργήσουμε ντόρο σχετικά με την καμπάνια μας, με το να ακουστεί στα social media. Θυμηθείτε να χρησιμοποιήσετε τα εργαλεία του Indiegogo αν θέλετε να μοιραστείτε πληροφορίες σχετικά με την καμπάνια μας. Αν ζείτε στην Αθήνα, ελάτε να δείτε την παράσταση μας στην Ομόνοια, τον Απρίλη.

Also, if your bank is Europe based, you could contribute directly to: 

Μπορείτε να καταθέσετε απευθείας στον παρακάτω λογαριασμό με την ένδειξη "ομόνοια":

*ΓΙΑ ΤΟΥΣ ΚΑΤΑΘΕΤΕΣ ΑΠΟ ΤΗΝ ΕΛΛΑΔΑ, ΜΠΟΡΕΙΤΕ ΜΟΝΟ ΜΕΣΩ ΤΟΥ ΠΑΡΑΚΑΤΩ ΛΟΓΑΡΙΑΣΜΟΥ ΝΑ ΣΥΝΕΙΣΦΕΡΕΤΕ ΛΟΓΩ CAPITAL CONTROL

Anastasia -Melina -Skoufou

IBAN GR2101101470000014760501669

National Bank of Greece

SWIFT-BIC: ETHNGRAA


For more information connect with us on Facebook

Our Facebook link is: https://www.facebook.com/omonoiaproject

story_txt:
“Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ - Plateia Omonoias -Concord” is a site specific physical theatre
performance, selected to be a part of the In Progress Feedback Festival (recognized by the
EFFE International Jury as one of Europe’s finest festivals) in Athens. “Concord” is an
international collaboration between Greek, Indian and Lithuanian artists, hosted and
coordinated by us, an Athens based theatre group called Simmoria tou iliou (Gang of the
Sun).

This physical theatre performance will take place at Omonia square (Omonia means ‘unity’ in Greek), a busy street in Athens where we will explore meetings in urban spaces, hoping to offer joy, love and hope in these conflict and despair ridden times.
 Even though In Progress Feedback Festival provides us with the fantastic opportunity to perform in public spaces in Athens, yet it is unable to provide any financial support. Our project, would not be possible without monetary aid as this is a free for all public art project, a non commercial venture. We seek your assistance to help us put together a performance that is not for a select few but attempts to create a joyous surprise and a sense of community for all passers by at the city square.
* ΟΙ ΕΛΛΗΝΕΣ ΚΑΤΑΘΕΤΕΣ ΠΑΡΑΚΑΛΟΥΜΕ ΔΕΙΤΕ ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ ΚΑΤΑΘΕΣΗΣ ΣΤΟ ΤΕΛΟΣ ΤΗΣ ΣΕΛΙΔΑΣ.
To “Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ - Plateia Omonoias -Concord” είναι μια site specific performance
σωματικού θεάτρου, η οποία επιλέχτηκε να παρουσιαστεί στα πλαίσια του In Progress
Feedback Festival (αναγνωρισμένο από τη Διεθνή Κριτική Επιτροπή EFFE ως ένα από τα
καλύτερα φεστιβάλ της Ευρώπης), στην Αθήνα. Πρόκειται για μια συνεργασία
καλλιτεχνών από Ελλάδα, Ινδία και Λιθουανία η οποία οργανώνεται και φιλοξενείται από
μια θεατρική ομάδα με έδρα την Αθήνα, τη Συμμορία του Ήλιου.
Αυτή η παράσταση σωματικού θεάτρου θα γίνει στην Πλατεία Ομονοίας όπου και θα
εξερευνήσει την έννοια των συναντήσεων στον αστικό χώρο, ελπίζοντας να προσφέρει
αγάπη και ελπίδα σε μια εποχή που τείνει να επικρατεί η σύγκρουση και η απελπισία.

Παρόλο που το In Progress Feedback Festival μας προσφέρει αυτή την φανταστική ευκαιρία
του να παίξουμε σε δημόσιους χώρους της Αθήνας δεν έχει τη δυνατότητα να μας
προσφέρει καμία οικονομική υποστήριξη. Το project μας δεν θα μπορέσει να
πραγματοποιηθεί χωρίς κάποια χρηματική συμβολή, καθώς πρόκειται για ένα καλλιτεχνικό
project που ελεύθερα μπορεί να το παρακολουθήσει κανείς. Ζητάμε λοιπόν τη βοήθειά
σας για να καταφέρουμε να συνθέσουμε αυτή την παράσταση που δεν θα είναι για λίγους,
αλλά θα επιχειρήσει να φέρει χαρά, έκπληξη και μια αίσθηση ενότητας σε όσους περνούν
από την πλατεία της πόλης.

Our Concept:







This year the theme of the In Progress Feedback Festival is ‘Urban Surprises’. We have
chosen Omonia Square for our performance with the aim of creating a performance that
explores playfulness and acceptance of diversity in a busy public place. Our objective is to
revive, invoke and play games that we used to as children. We were inspired by the history
of this particular square as it is an iconic Athenian square that used to be a very popular
meeting point for the people of Athens. Of late, however, a lot of people avoid crossing the
square due to fear of encountering homeless people and drug addicts. Games that we used
to play as children on the streets become the pivotal point to explore meetings in urban
areas and communication with strangers we inhabit the same space with but seldom
communicate joyously and fearlessly with.

Η ιδέα μας:


Αυτή τη χρονιά το θέμα του In Progress Feedback Festival είναι οι ' Αστικές Εκπλήξεις'.
Διαλέξαμε την πλατεία Ομονοίας για το project μας με σκοπό να δημιουργήσουμε μια
παράσταση που θα εξερευνά την ανάγκη μας για παιχνίδι και την αποδοχή της
διαφορετικότητας σε ένα πολυσύχναστοδημόσιο χώρο. Σκοπεύουμε να ανασύρουμε, να
θυμηθούμε και να παίξουμε τα παιχνίδια που συνηθίζαμε ως παιδιά. Εμπνευστήκαμε από
την ιστορία της συγκεκριμένης πλατείας, καθώς ήταν μια πλατεία των Αθηνών που
χρησιμοποιούνταν ως σημείο συνάντησης των κατοίκων της πόλης. Τα τελευταία χρόνια, πολύς κόσμος την αποφεύγει από φόβο συνάντησης με χρήστες ναρκωτικών ή
αστέγων. Παιχνίδια που συνηθίζαμε να παίζουμε ως παιδιά στους δρόμους γίνονται ο
κεντρικός άξονας από τον οποίο θα εξερευνήσουμε τις συναντήσεις στις αστικές περιοχές
και την επικοινωνία με αγνώστους με τους οποίους μοιραζόμαστε τον ίδιο χώρο αλλά
σπάνια επικοινωνούμε με χαρά και δίχως φόβο μαζί τους.






The traffic light turns red; 
a cacophony of rushing feet. 

We catch the corner of each other's eyes, 
we don't stop and greet.
Avoid physical contact carefully 
My crisp white shirt 







Mustn't get tarnished 
By your bohemian ideology. 
I haven't heard of the name 
Of the town you were born in. 
If only, I had asked you of the game
You played as a child, down your alley. 
Truth be told, we’re scared we might find 
That a smile can travel far,
And there is so much to unite us strangers 
Who on first glance, 
thought they were most unlike each other. 

~by Manjari Kaul, the codirector of Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ Plateia Omonoias Concord


Το φανάρι γίνεται κόκινο;
μια κακοφωνία απο βιαστικά πόδια .
Πιάνουμε ο ένας την ακρη του ματιού του άλλου,
δεν σταματάμε να χαιρετήσουμε.
Αποφεύγουμε την σωματική επαφή προσεκτικά
Το κάτασπρο πουκάμισό μου
Δεν πρέπει να λερώσει απο την μποέμ ιδεολογία σου
Δεν έχω ξανακούσει αυτό το όνομα
Της πόλης που έχεις γεννηθεί
Έτσι και σε είχα ρωτήσει για το παιχνίδι
που έπαιξες ως παιδί, στη γειτονιά σου.
Η αλήθεια να λέγεται, φοβόμαστε πως ίσως και να βρίσκαμε
πως ένα χαμόγελο μπορεί να ταξιδέψει πολύμακριά
και πως είναι τόσα πολλά αυτά που μας ενώνουν εμάς τους ξένους
που με την πρώτη ματιά
νομίσαμε πως ήμασταν τόσο διαφορετικοί.

~απο την Manjari Kaul, μια απο τις δυο σκηνοθέτες του Πλας ντε λα Κονκόρντ Plateia Omonoias Concord

The project is hosted and coordinated by Athens based theatre group Simmoria tou iliou,
established by Melina Skoufou in 2012. The play “Eviva!”,  is  the company's most recent success . Traveling together in the same train, two Greek women one of our own troubled  times and another one of the same age, having lived the tough times of the German occupation in Greece. They meet. A journey through their memories with fast motion, humor and emotion, which was performed for two years in a well known theater in Athens.
Το project οργανώνει και φιλοξενεί η ομάδα "Συμμορία του Ήλιου" που έχει έδρα την
Αθήνα και έχει ιδρυθεί το 2012 απο τη Μελίνα Σκούφου.  Το έργο "Εβίβα!" είναι η πιο πρόσφατη επιτυχία της ομάδας . Συνταξιδιώτισσες στο ίδιο βαγόνι,  "συναντιούνται" μία νεαρή κοπέλα της δικής μας ταραγμένης εποχής και μια  συνομήλική της, από τα δύσκολα χρόνια της γερμανικής κατοχής στην  Ελλάδα. Ένα ταξίδι ζωής στις αναμνήσεις των δύο  γυναικών με πολύ γρήγορους ρυθμούς, συγκίνηση και χιούμορ, που παρουσιάστηκε για δύο χρονιές σε γνωστό θέατρο της Αθήνας.

Our Team:

CoDirectors: Melina Skoufou and Manjari Kaul 
Assistant Director: Victoria Papamichail

Choreography: Giedre Degutyte

Tsourou

Φωτογραφία-Κινηματογράφηση: Γιώργος Βουρσούκης

Τσούρου

Melina Skoufou

Melina is a performer and a director, based in Athens. Studied Acting and Directing at the
University of Peloponnese. In July 2012 she established "Simmoria tou iliou" (Gang of the
Sun), a group for research in the Arts. She has worked as an assistant director in various
productions and theatre in Athens, Cyprus and Germany and has the experience of running
theatre sessions in mental health centres. As a painter she has done two exhibitions in
Athens and Nafplio. She trained at The Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre in
Athens in autumn, 2015. For more information on Melina’s theatre group:
http://www.symmoriatouiliou.com/
https://www.facebook.com/evivaa/

Μελίνα Σκούφου

Η Μελίνα είναι performer και σκηνοθέτης. Σπούδασε στο Πανεπιστήμιο της Πελοποννήσου.
Τον Ιούλιο του 2012 ίδρυσε τη Συμμορία του Ήλιου, μια ομάδα για έρευνα στις τέχνες. Έχει
δουλέψει ως βοηθός σκηνοθέτη σε παραγωγές και διάφορα θέατρα της Αθήνας,
της Κύπρου και της Γερμανίας και έχει εμπειρία συντονισμού ομάδων σε ιδρύματα ψυχικά
ασθενών. Έχει κάνει δυο εκθέσεις ζωγραφικής στην Αθήνα και το Ναύπλιο. Εκπαιδεύτηκε
επίσης στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre το φθινόπωρο του 2015 στην
Αθήνα. Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με τη δουλειά της Μελίνας:

http://www.symmoriatouiliou.com
https://www.facebook.com/evivaa/








Manjari Kaul

Manjari is an artist at DUENDE and a performer/ theatre director and Arts Writer, based in
India. She trained at the Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre in Athens in autumn,
2015. In 2014, she premiered her solo show, Chronicle of a Death Foretold, an adaptation of
Gabriel Garcia Marquez's novel at The Delhi International Arts Festival and which has since
travelled to Lucknow and Bangalore as well. She works extensively with children, engaging
them in understanding their own bodies to communicate, learn and comprehend real and
imagined worlds. For more information on Manjari’s work:
https://www.facebook.com/improperfractionstheatre/ and
https://manjarikaul.wordpress.com/category/performance/

Manjari Kaul

Η Manjari είναι μια απο τους καλλιτέχνες των DUENDE και μια performer, σκηνοθέτης και
συγγραφέας Τεχνών, με έδρα την Ινδία. Εκπαιδεύτηκε στο Duende School Of Ensemble
Physical Theatre το φθινόπωρο του 2015 στην Αθήνα. Το 2014 παρουσίασε για πρώτη
φορά τη σόλο παράστασή της, Το χρονικό ενός προαναγγελθέντος θανάτου, μια διασκευή
του διηγήματος του Gabriel Garcia Marquez's, στο 'The Delhi International Arts Festival' και
απο τότε έχει παρουσιαστεί επίσης στο Lucknow and Bangalore. Δουλεύει εκτεταμένα με
παιδιά προσπαθώντας να τους ενισχύσει την κατανόηση του σώματός τους ως μέσω
επικοινωνίας, μάθησης και αντίληψης αληθινών και φανταστικών κόσμων. Για
περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με τη δουλειά της Manjari:

https://www.facebook.com/improperfractionstheatre/ and
https://manjarikaul.wordpress.com/category/performance/

Victoria Papamichail

Victoria lives and works in Thessaloniki, in Northern Greece. She studied Psychophysical
Acting and Improvisation and has been involved in playback theatre, an interactive form of
improvisation through storytelling, for over a decade. She trained at the Duende School of
Ensemble Physical Theatre in Athens in autumn 2015.

Βικτώρια Παπαμιχαήλ

Η Βικτώρια ζει και εργάζεται στην Θεσσαλονίκη, στη βόρεια Ελλάδα. Σπούδασε
Psychophysical Τheatre και Αυτοσχεδιασμό και έχει ασχοληθεί με το θέατρο Playback, μία
διαδραστική μορφή αυτοσχεδιασμού μέσω εξιστόρησης, για πάνω από μια δεκαετία.
Εκπαιδεύτηκε στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre στην Αθήνα , το φθινόπωρο
του 2015.








Giedre Degutyte

Giedre is a performer and circus artist from Lithuania, currently based in the UK. A Graduate
in Cultural Studies at University of Leeds, she has trained in physical theatre and
improvisation at the Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

For more information on Giedre’s work: http://circulardreams.weebly.com/hoop.html 
Giedre Dequtyte

Η Giedre μια performer και καλλιτέχνης του τσίρκου από τη Λιθουανία, η οποία αυτή την
περίοδο ζει στην Αγγλία. Είνα απόφοιτη του τμήματος Cultural Studies του leeds Univercity
UK και έχει επείσης εκπαιδευτεί στο σωματικό θέατρο και τον αυτοσχεδιασμό στο Duende
School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με τη δουλειά της Giedre:
http://circulardreams.weebly.com/hoop.html

Eva Tsourou

Eva is a dancer and an aerial performer, based in Athens. She has worked internationally in
circus and dance. She is a member of DUENDE Ensemble . Eva performs with the ensemble
and teaches dance, choreography and physical skills development during company
workshops and residencies. She is the main physical trainer at the DUENDE School of
Ensemble Physical Theatre.

Εύα Τσούρου

Η Εύα είναι χορεύτρια και εναέρια performer. Έχει δουλέψει διεθνώς στο χώρο του
σωματικού θεάτρου και του τσίρκου. Είναι μέλος του DUENDE ensemble. Η Εύα παίρνει
μέρος στις παραγωγές της ομάδας ως performer και διδάσκει χορό, χορογραφία και
εξέλιξη της κίνησης στα residencies και τα σεμινάρια της ομάδας. Έχει επίσης αναλάβει τη
διδασκαλία της σωματικής εκπαίδευσης στο Duende School of Ensemble Physical Theatre.

Georgia Bourda

Georgia is a set and costume designer, prop maker and set constructor, born in
Thessaloniki, currently based Athens. She has worked on various theater productions in
Greece and has collaborated with Simmoria tou Iliou in their theater performances and
workshop. http://georgiabourda.com/

Γεωργία Μπούρδα

Η Γεωργία είναι σκηνογράφος και ενδυματολόγος. Γεννήθηκε στην Θεσαλονίκη και πλέον
μένει μόνιμα στην Αθήνα. Έχει δουλέψει σε διάφορες θεατρικές παραγωγές και έχει
συνεργαστεί με τη Συμμορία του Ήλιου σε διάφορες παραγωγές και σεμινάρια της ομάδας.

http://georgiabourda.com/ 
Andreas Skoufos








Andreas is a music composer, sound designer and drummer based in Athens. He studied
Sound Engineering, Digital Audio Editing & Digital Video Editing and 3D Design & Animation.
He has worked in several theatre productions in the capacity of a musician. He is also a
member of the group Simmoria tou Iliou.

Αντρέας Σκούφος

Ο Αντρέας είναι μουσικός συνθέτης, sound designer και drummer με έδρα την Αθήνα.
Σπούδασε Sound Engineering, Digital Audio Editing & Digital Video Editing and 3D Design &
Animation.Έχει δουλέψει σε διάφορες θεατρικές παραγωγές ως μουσικός. Είναι και αυτός
μέλος της Συμμορίας του Ήλιου.

Giorgos Voursoukis
Giorgos is a proffesional photographer based in Athens.
For more information about Giorgos: www.light-house.gr

Γιώργος Βουρσούκης
Ο Γιώργος είναι επαγγελματίας φωτογράφος με έδρα την Αθήνα.
Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες σχετικά με το Γιώργο:
www.light-house.gr

What We Need and What You Get:
“Concord” is a public art project that is NOT ticketed to help make it accessible to all. If you
decide to contribute, your money will go towards artists’ travel expenses, their fees,
production expenses like costumes, sets, music and documentation of the performance. In
case we do not reach our entire goal, we may not be able to afford to have such a diverse
group of collaborators. However, the project will still take place, though under a tight
budget. Your support is extremely valuable and encouraging for us as it is fantastic to be
able to realise a project for the community, supported by a community. To express our
heartfelt gratitude to you we promise to keep you updated on the progress of the project
and also send small surprises to your mailbox.

Τι χρειαζόμαστε και τι μπορείτε να μας προσφέρετε:
Το 'Concord' παρόλο που θα είναι μια δημόσια παράσταση δεν θα έχει εισιτήριο έτσι ώστε
να δώσει τη δυνατότητα σε όποιον θελήσει να το παρακολουθήσει. Αν αποφασίσεις να
συνεισφέρεις, τα χρήματα σου θα χρησιμοποιηθούν στα έξοδα εισιτηρίων των καλλιτεχνών,
στις αμοιβές τους, σε έξοδα παραγωγής όπως σκηνικά, κουστούμια, μουσική και
βιντεοσκόπηση-φωτογράφηση της παράστασης. Σε περίπτωση που δεν καταφέρουμε να
φτάσουμε το χρηματικό στόχο τότε ενδεχόμενα να μην αλλάξει η σύσταση της ομάδας.
Όπως και να πάντως, το project θα πραγματοποιηθεί με ένα πιο σφιχτό budjet. Η
υποστήριξή σας είναι πολύτιμη και εξαιρετικά ενθαρρυντική για μας αφού είναι υπέροχο








να δημιουργείς ένα project για την κοινότητα το οποίο υποστηρίζετε από την ίδια την
κοινότητα. Για να εκφράσουμε την απο καρδιάς ευγνωμοσύνη μας υποσχόμαστε να σας
κρατάμε ενήμερους για την πρόοδο του project καθώς και να σας στέλνουμε έξυπνες
εκπλήξεις στο mail σας.

Impact:
The aim of our public art project is to offer joy, love and hope in what are difficult times for
the world (especially Greece), fraught with problems of xenophobia, racism and economic
meltdown. If you contribute to the campaign, you will be contributing towards a
transformation through art, momentary though it may be, of a hostile urban environment.
Also, you will be helping us put together a performance that is not for a select few but
attempts to create a sense of community and connection for all passers by at this Grecian
city square.

Ιmpact:
Ο στόχος του δημόσιου καλλιτεχνικού μας project είναι να προσφέρουμε χαρά, αγάπη
και ελπίδα σε δύσκολες εποχές σε παγκόσμιο επίπεδο, αλλά και στην Ελλάδα
συγκεκριμένα, γεμάτες ξενοφοβία, ρατσισμό και οικονομική κατάρρευση. Αν συνεισφέρεις
στην καμπάνια, θα συνεισφέρεις ως προς μια μεταμόρφωση μέσω της τέχνης, έστω και
προσωρινής, ενός εχθρικού αστικού τοπίου. Επίσης, θα βοηθήσεις ώστε να δημιουργηθεί μια
παράσταση που δεν θα είναι για λίγους αλλά που θα προσπαθήσει να δημιουργήσει μια
αίσθηση κοινότητας και ενότητας για όλους τους περαστικούς αυτής της Ελληνικής
πλατείας.


Other ways you can help:
If the project interests you, but you are unable to contribute money, it does not mean you
cannot help. You could help us create some buzz about our campaign, get the word out on
social media. Do remember to use Indiegogo share tools if you are sharing information
about our campaign. And if you are Athens based, do come to watch our performance at
Omonia Square in April, 2016.

Άλλοι τρόποι που μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε:
Αν σας ενδιαφέρει το project αλλά δεν μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε, αυτό δεν σημαίνει ότι
δεν μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε. Μπορείτε να μας βοηθήσετε να δημιουργήσουμε ντόρο
σχετικά με την καμπάνια μας, με το να ακουστεί στα social media. Θυμηθείτε να
χρησιμοποιήσετε τα εργαλεία του Indiegogo αν θέλετε να μοιραστείτε πληροφορίες σχετικά
με την καμπάνια μας. Αν ζείτε στην Αθήνα, ελάτε να δείτε την παράσταση μας στην
Ομόνοια, τον Απρίλη.








Also, if your bank is Europe based, you could contribute directly to: 

Μπορείτε να καταθέσετε απευθείας στον παρακάτω λογαριασμό με την ένδειξη "ομόνοια":
*ΓΙΑ ΤΟΥΣ ΚΑΤΑΘΕΤΕΣ ΑΠΟ ΤΗΝ ΕΛΛΑΔΑ, ΜΠΟΡΕΙΤΕ ΜΟΝΟ ΜΕΣΩ ΤΟΥ ΠΑΡΑΚΑΤΩ ΛΟΓΑΡΙΑΣΜΟΥ ΝΑ ΣΥΝΕΙΣΦΕΡΕΤΕ ΛΟΓΩ CAPITAL CONTROL
Anastasia -Melina -Skoufou

IBAN GR2101101470000014760501669
National Bank of Greece
SWIFT-BIC: ETHNGRAA


For more information connect with us on Facebook
Our Facebook link is: https://www.facebook.com/omonoiaproject 
Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες συνδεθείτε μαζί μας στο Facebook. To link μας είναι : https://www.facebook.com/omonoiaproject

story:
WHAT THIS CAMPAIGN IS ABOUT!

Hello, I'm Kelly Alvarez and my Los Angeles-based company of talented dancers and I need your help! Kelly Alvarez and Dancers has been chosen to present work at the Rocky Mountain Choreography Festival in Ogden, Utah on February 19th and 20th, 2016. We have a limited time to gather resources to get us there! 

ABOUT THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN CHOREOGRAPHY FESTIVAL:

"The Rocky Mountain Choreography Festival is a unique opportunity for local and national talent to come to the heart of the Rocky Mountains to display their work. Accepted entries will compete at the historic Peery’s Egyptian Theater located in downtown Ogden. The historic district is ideal for hosting large groups and provides ideal venues and attractions for out-of-town guests. Finalists chosen will travel and perform the submitted choreography live at the Peery’s Egyptian Theater before a general audience and panel of judges and compete to have an evening of dance presented at the Peery’s Egyptian Theater. Choreographers are responsible for getting your dancers to Ogden for the performance."

Please visit http://imagineballet.org/rocky-mountain-choreography-festival/ for more details.


ABOUT US:

KELLY ALVAREZ is a native of Los Angeles and has performed with companies such as  PTERO Dance Theatre, Brockus Project Dance Company, Winifred R. Harris' Between Lines, and MULTIPLEX Dance. Her choreography has been selected to be presented at the Dance Under the Stars Choreography Festival, The Celebrate Dance Festival, Dancers Responding to AIDS, The GLUE Performance Series, Dance! Santa Monica, MixMatch Dance Festival, and DanceSpot LA, among others. She received her BFA in Modern Dance with honors from The University of the Arts and a Masters in Dance from the University of California, Irvine. Kelly has been on faculty at UC Irvine and Cypress College, and is currently an Adjunct Professor in Dance at Loyola Marymount University, as well as the Ballet Director at Revolution Dance Center in Montrose, CA.

You can learn more about Kelly here: http://www.kellyalvarezdance.com/

I am blessed to be working with these amazing artists for this project:

CAROLE BIERS (Invertigo Dance Theater)

AVA GORDY (Pittsburgh Dance Theatre & Civic Ballet of Chicago)

TRACY SHEN (Re:borN Dance Interactive)

CODY WILBOURN (Invertigo Dance Theater)

LANI YAMANAKA (Entity Contemporary Dance)

(A special thanks to the dancers featured in the work-in-progress video above: Jestoni Dagdag, Ava Gordy, Caitlin Hicks, Jessica Ryan, Cody Wilbourn, and Mollie Wolf)

WHY THIS PROJECT IS IMPORTANT...

  • This tour will serve as a launch pad for future opportunities to travel and get our work seen!
  • Kelly Alvarez and Dancers is, at this time, completely self-financed. 
  • Dancers are some of the hardest working individuals I know! We often hold multiple jobs and rehearse long hours on top of all of our other commitments!!! 
  • Because of this and a myriad of other reasons, I REFUSE TO ASK MY DANCERS TO WORK FOR FREE!
  • Airfare and car rental from Los Angeles, CA to Ogden, UT currently ranges from $150-$300 per person. We will also need funds for car rental and hotel accommodations.
  • Lastly, but in many ways most importantly..... Let's get these LA artists to other areas of the country, so we may expand our audience, get seen, and INCREASE INTEREST IN LOS ANGELES-BASED DANCE!


What We Need!!

  • Airfare from Los Angeles, CA to Salt Lake City, UT for six dancers. Prices currently range from $150-$300 per person.
  • Van rental to get from SLC airport to the venue in Ogden (1 hr away). Plus gas money.
  • Hotel accommodations for six people for two nights.
  • Artist pay!! The more funds we raise the more I can pay my dancers!! Let's show them they deserve the very best!
  • Application fee of $75 has already been paid. 
  • Some costumes have already been paid for as well. We will need a little more cash for additional costumes. 
  • Food: Dancers eat, too!!
  • Studio rental: We are rehearsing in various locations and some of those locations require a studio rental fee. This can range from $15-$20 per hour.

What You Get!!!

  • Check out our PERKS!! Not only do you get the amazing satisfaction of helping artists undertake this creative endeavor but you get our eternal love and appreciation!!
  • PERKS include: A personalized postcard from our destination signed by the dancers, an autographed DVD of the performance, a video & social media shout-outs, private lessons from the Artistic Director, Kelly Alvarez, and much more!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute funds to our campaign but still want to support us, you can still help tremendously by:

  • Spreading the word! Please share this page and tell all your friends!
  • Sending your positive vibes for safe travels, successful performances, and a chance to win the audience vote to return in the fall!

Application fee of $75 has already been paid. 
Some costumes have already been paid for as well. We will need a little more cash for additional costumes. 
Food: Dancers eat, too!!
Studio rental: We are rehearsing in various locations and some of those locations require a studio rental fee. This can range from $15-$20 per hour.



What You Get!!!

Check out our PERKS!! Not only do you get the amazing satisfaction of helping artists undertake this creative endeavor but you get our eternal love and appreciation!!
PERKS include: A personalized postcard from our destination signed by the dancers, an autographed DVD of the performance, a video & social media shout-outs, private lessons from the Artistic Director, Kelly Alvarez, and much more!


    
Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute funds to our campaign but still want to support us, you can still help tremendously by:

Spreading the word! Please share this page and tell all your friends! Sending your positive vibes for safe travels, successful performances, and a chance to win the audience vote to return in the fall!

story:
Short Summary

Nicky Diss & Thomas Judd set up Thick as Thieves last year. Our aim is to bring clear, accessible and entertaining Shakespeare to a broad audience.

It’s common to hear people saying they don’t enjoy Shakespeare because it’s boring or because it’s too difficult to understand. The thing is though, Shakespeare is neither of those things. It’s inherently entertaining, poetic, moving and hilarious. And it should be easy to follow!

Following our critically acclaimed and award-nominated The Tempest, we are returning to The Hope Theatre with our gender-balanced production of Twelfth Night.

How we work

  • We start with the first folio text, and make sure first and foremost that everything is clear - if the actors don’t understand what they’re saying, the audience definitely won’t.
  • All our productions have a cast of four actors, two male and two female. Whilst this is obviously a challenge, it adds to the fun of the production necessitating breakneck costume changes and clear characterisation.
  • We like to break down theatrical conventions and involve our audience. We’re always on stage (which includes changing costume), the audience is lit, we do the lighting and sound ourselves, we directly address the audience, and include elements of interaction and improvisation. We believe these are all things that make the audience as much a part of the production as the actors - and that’s what makes theatre so exciting, the fact that every performance is different and alive.
  • We are running this production under the Equity Fringe Minimum agreement which means that all our actors are being paid slightly over minimum wage for their work.  

Reviews for 'The Tempest', July 2015

  • “Bursting with energy and a laugh a minute...the most fun I've ever had at a Shakespeare production” **** - Everything Theatre, 
  • “A must-see for Shakespeare lovers and Shakespeare phobics alike” **** - The Upcoming
  • "This is a company with ambition and most importantly, the talent to match it." **** - Views From the Gods 
  • "This production is a wonderful example of the versatility and beauty of the playwright’s work and is highly recommended" **** - Carn's Theatre Passion
  • "Thick as Thieves are blessed with an extremely personable and talented acting quartet. As they work their magic on the audience, the laughter quickly becomes infectious." **** - London City Nights
  • "With a minimum of actors, the cast of The Tempest have produced a top-notch show." **** - Female Arts
  • "Simply irresistible...it does more than just make Shakespeare accessible; it makes Shakespeare hilarious" **** - Ginger Hibiscus


Other Ways You Can Help

Book a ticket to our show http://www.thehopetheatre.com/productions/twelfth-night/ and bring as many people as you can...
Follow us on twitter (@thickthieves) and perhaps retweet our fundraising campaign or indeed anything about the show.
Take a look at our website www.thickasthievestheatre.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello here at the 'Twonkey Drive-In' company, we are excited to be taking a show that's been in development for nearly two years to glitzy Edinburgh. 

The team comprises of professional actors Ben Nardone & Miranda Shrapnell,  director/performer Simon Jay, cabaret superstar Paul Vickers and topped off with a big dollop of musician in the form of Pete Harvey. 

The idea of 'Jennifer's Robot Arm' started off life as a short story written by Vickers as part of one of his hugely successful 'Twonkey' shows at the Edinburgh Fringe. From this Vickers wrote a full-length play which was awarded £300 of funding by the Tom McGrath foundation, this was put on as a rehearsed reading in Feb 2015 at The White Bear Theatre; this transferred in a more developed form to The Bread and Roses Theatre in April. Since then the play has been worked on by Paul and the team. 

This campaign means so much to us as we feel due the comedic and absurdist nature of the play (it's plot concerns a family in the north whose life is turned upside down when their daughter's arm is sawn off. A sinister inventor builds the girl a robotic arm but it comes at a malevolent price.) we've been overlooked for grant and development money. We're going ahead with the show, but we want to be able to subsidise some of the costs we're incurring. 

Our campaign is tailored to give perks to Edinburgh stalwarts and fans alike. We know how hard it is to put on a show and we don't want to whinge about that, we bask in the challenges of the fringe, it makes us work hard, but we do want to respect the creatives in the team and make sure we can do our job properly and give the audience a brilliant show. 

Without your support we wont have a show, we feel it's the only way to get something diverse and different on the fringe without watering it down to something overly cynical and commercial. 

We've already been helped wonderfully, such as The Sweet Venues providing one of their best 100 seater rooms for the show. There is certainly a lot of faith in the project.

What We Need & What You Get

We've accounted for everything in the production and boiled it down the most reasonable amount that we'd need to raise to subsidise aspects of the show. We're personally bankrolling 2.5k already. 

Here's a breakdown of everything: 

£100 - Travel

£400 - Costume 

£400 - Set

£159 - 5% Indiegogo charge

£180 - Sweet Venues Marketing

£2.1k - Accommodation for the cast. 

If we make 75% of our goal we can still make up the short-fall and work on free sourcing costume and set, this will be time-consuming but we're prepared to put in the effort. 

The perks we have are many and varied from limited edition art, programmes and C.D's. To material specific to the project and stuff even made for the individual!!! Below is a breakdown of the perks that will be offered: 

[£50 and higher you get the previous perks included up to the price you give]

£25  - Twonkey's Cottage standard;  

  • An A3 poster of Jennifer's Robot Arm defaced by the cast. 
  • A copy of the first rehearsed reading of Jennifer's Robot Arm starring Myra Dubois.

£50 - Twonkey's Kingdom Standard; 

  • A copy of 'The Making of Jennifer's Robot Arm' A full length documentary (delivered August) detailing the rehearsal process of the new show will be made available exclusively to Indiegogo donators. *

£75 -  Twonkey's Blue Cadabra Standard; 

  • Exclusive Demo tracks to Jennifer's Robot Arm, 5 BRAND NEW SONGS sung by Paul Vickers, delivered immediately. (8 months before release)

£100  -  Twonkey's Universe Standard; 

  • Only available to Indiegogo Donators, a brand new audio-play 'The Handmaiden and the Albatross' starring Paul Vickers, the play includes a follow-along play-script and Twonkey Scrapbook. *

£200 -  Twonkey's Silver Amulet Standard: 

  • A dirty hamper full of Twonkey treats including albums, books and photography. 

£300 -  Twonkey's Gold surgical stocking Standard;  

  • Paul Vicker's will write a short story on parchment scroll which will be tailored to some of your requests. 
  • A piece of Twonkey Memorabilia such as dolls, costumes and sets used in original Twonkey shows (each donation will allow you to choose 1 item from a list):
  • The actual COTTAGE from Twonkey's Cottage
  • A special Jesus lamp. 
  • A map of Twonkey's World on a big huge rag.

The Impact

  • If we can make this indiegogo campaign successful it means that we can show future producers and funders evidence that there is a real desire to see the kind of work Paul Vickers and the rest of the company make. Your money will have a knock-on effect far beyond the initial payment. So don't think 'what goods a fiver here, or a tenner there' because it all adds up and the more people we have as funders the more we can show there is a demand for our kind of work. 
  • Director/Producer Simon Jay has crowdfunded a majority of his theatre projects through indiegogo, as well as giving money to other projects on indiegogo, it's a great community where funding a project allows you to be part of the community that makes that project, it's a great way to contribute to the arts and to build something for a specific community. 
  • If you fund us, we want to hear from why you are giving us money, whether it's a £1 or a £1000 we want your feedback, we owe it to you for investing in us, we want to make the show the best it can be. 'Get involved' as they say.

Risks & Challenges


  • Having done 40 to 50 shows between us a group, we are well versed on the many, varied and ridiculous obstacles that can befall a production, from actors falling sick, to venues burning down; and we can say that we've never had to cancel a show yet. We work doggedly to the last moment to get the show up. 
  • We have guarantors and patrons of the umbrella company that is putting on J.R.A.; Jaybird Productions.
  • We also have a large amount of creative friends we can rely on to help if problems arise. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We really, really, really need to get this out to as many people as possible, if you've seen Paul or any of the teams work, sharing it with fans or people who are passionate about the arts, it would be a great help. 

Thank-you

A copy of the first rehearsed reading of Jennifer's Robot Arm starring Myra Dubois.


£50 - Twonkey's Kingdom Standard; 

A copy of 'The Making of Jennifer's Robot Arm' A full length documentary (delivered August) detailing the rehearsal process of the new show will be made available exclusively to Indiegogo donators. *

£75 -  Twonkey's Blue Cadabra Standard; 

Exclusive Demo tracks to Jennifer's Robot Arm, 5 BRAND NEW SONGS sung by Paul Vickers, delivered immediately. (8 months before release)

£100  -  Twonkey's Universe Standard; 

Only available to Indiegogo Donators, a brand new audio-play 'The Handmaiden and the Albatross' starring Paul Vickers, the play includes a follow-along play-script and Twonkey Scrapbook. *

£200 -  Twonkey's Silver Amulet Standard: 

A dirty hamper full of Twonkey treats including albums, books and photography. 

£300 -  Twonkey's Gold surgical stocking Standard;  


Paul Vicker's will write a short story on parchment scroll which will be tailored to some of your requests. 
A piece of Twonkey Memorabilia such as dolls, costumes and sets used in original Twonkey shows (each donation will allow you to choose 1 item from a list):
The actual COTTAGE from Twonkey's Cottage
A special Jesus lamp. 
A map of Twonkey's World on a big huge rag.
   The Impact 
If we can make this indiegogo campaign successful it means that we can show future producers and funders evidence that there is a real desire to see the kind of work Paul Vickers and the rest of the company make. Your money will have a knock-on effect far beyond the initial payment. So don't think 'what goods a fiver here, or a tenner there' because it all adds up and the more people we have as funders the more we can show there is a demand for our kind of work.  Director/Producer Simon Jay has crowdfunded a majority of his theatre projects through indiegogo, as well as giving money to other projects on indiegogo, it's a great community where funding a project allows you to be part of the community that makes that project, it's a great way to contribute to the arts and to build something for a specific community.  If you fund us, we want to hear from why you are giving us money, whether it's a £1 or a £1000 we want your feedback, we owe it to you for investing in us, we want to make the show the best it can be. 'Get involved' as they say.    Risks & Challenges
  Having done 40 to 50 shows between us a group, we are well versed on the many, varied and ridiculous obstacles that can befall a production, from actors falling sick, to venues burning down; and we can say that we've never had to cancel a show yet. We work doggedly to the last moment to get the show up.  We have guarantors and patrons of the umbrella company that is putting on J.R.A.; Jaybird Productions.
We also have a large amount of creative friends we can rely on to help if problems arise.     Other Ways You Can Help We really, really, really need to get this out to as many people as possible, if you've seen Paul or any of the teams work, sharing it with fans or people who are passionate about the arts, it would be a great help. 
Thank-you

story:
WAF: We Almost Forgot, what life was all about..

How do we attain Grace within the muffling burden of memories? How do we remember when there are no words, when all we have are flashes of body memories?

Artistic Intent- Qudus Onikeku:

After almost two decades of performing, creating works and touring, and now as the Artistic director of #WeAlmostForgot, i think this is indeed going to be a rare experience, not just for me alone nor the entire creative team, but most especially for the audience. In this new creation, with 8 artistes on stage, all from varied backgrounds and identities, we shall destroy assumptions and attempt to speak about memories and the marks they leave on the body. Through the use of high energy movements, story telling, singing and music, I am hoping to create a show whose beauty is mostly in its cathartic abilities to heal, to restore and to remember.

#WeAlmostForgot will imagine the past as an entity, that has returned to tell the present of its own horrors, of what we must hear in order to make proper sense of it, rather than offering a reconciliation or a realistic account, it has simply come on a cathartic mission, delivering our headlines in unforgettable personal stories. Beyond history and memory, what else has the past got to offer the present?

We are looking to raise $15 000 before our premier in June 2016 (the date shall be communicated later). After almost 2 years of personal creative process, gathering the needed materials to create this work, then almost a year of sourcing for funds, reaching out to create possible partnerships, we have been able to raise up to 80% percent of our total budget, but we are still few miles away from raising the needed amount to conclude the creation, as at now, we are 20% away from the creation budget. Although with the help of the understanding team, work have started but at the end, we will need to financially cover up a lot of loop holes, here is why we need your BIG heart and GIVING spirit to make this happen. Your generosity through the funds raised in this campaign, will go towards production elements as we get to the end of our creation period, and plan a befitting world premier in Berlin.

Qudus Onikeku is the Artistic director and founder of YK Projects, Born in Lagos and a graduate of The National Higher School of Circus Arts - France. For more than a decade, he has retained a presence in the Nigerian choreographic scene, and part of the new generation creators springing up from Africa. Known in Europe, Asia, in the USA, Latin America and the Caribbean for his solo works, writings and research projects. Choreographer of and also a dancer in the piece"


Making of the team:

2 years ago, i decided to return to Lagos, after a decade of living in Paris, my career as a dancer/choreographer quickly became international, and quite successful with my previous works, but the need to shift base became paramount, mostly because i believe that if Africa is the future, as the empty slogan goes, then the future must be now, then i moved to Lagos and opened a dance center called The QDanceCenter, working mostly with young people and also traveling the continent.

In early 2015 i went to Gabon to do some teaching and mentoring, there i met Gaëlle, whom i thought i'd like to have in my team. Later same year i was invited by the British Council, Lagos, to create a piece with dancers with and without disabilities, and i produced IWA L'EWA with Debby as a major dancer in it, her presence struck me, regardless of her scoliosis, i knew she had to be a part of WAF. And Ese however had been in my previous work 'My Exile is in my Head" since i knew I'll be needing an actress in this, i could think of no one but her.

Then in December 2015, we organized a 3days workshop/audition session in Paris, from there, i was drawn to the peculiar talents of Gwen, Sonia and Tidjiani, and one of the rarest creative team was made. We created a facebook group were we all interacted freely till we all met in Paris from January 18, 2016, to begin the process. It has been a physically and emotionally challenging work, but the bonding that existed was solid enough to be a motivation and a reason to want to go till the end of the journey.

Meet the team:

Gwen Rakotovao was born in France with Madagascan origin, a contemporary dancer and a graduate of the Alvin Ailey School, in New York. Gwen has worked with renowned choreographers, participating and winning international dance competitions. Gwen also have her company that tours her personal works internationally.

Sonia Al-Khadir. A double Masters holder in social anthropology with specialization in dance, her passion for contemporary dance has earned her various certifications and participate in major Master classes given by renowned choreographers. Of Moroccan and Algerian origin but born in France, Sonia continues her academic research in dance and also teaches contemporary dance.

Tidjiani N'Diaye is originally from Mali where he started his dance career, he has choreographed and performed under his own company "Copier Coller" registered in Mali, Tidjiani has also worked with known names in the dance world. Living between France and Mali, he participated in various training and also holds a university degree in performing arts and holds a master degree in choreography.

Deborah Aiyegbeni is one of the new talents springing out of Lagos, Nigeria. Deborah has participated in dance workshops and training, one of the star dancers in the popular dance production IWA L'EWA (Lagos) which was her major production. Deborah was selected to participate in the P.A.R.T.S / Ecole de sables internship program. 

Gaëlle Ikonda.  With her Hip Hop and contemporary dance background, she has been able to integrate in various dance projects and also travelled around Africa participating in workshops and dance performances. Gaëlle is one of Gabon's talented dancers.

Ese Brume is an actress-performer-vocalist who was born and grew up in Nigeria before exploring the world, she has been in the exclusive contemporary Parisian theatre scene with over 20 years of experience. A Muse for painters, poets, musicians and playwrights she has travelled the world on stage performing.

Our ways of saying “Thank You”

We are saying a warm thank you in advance for your kind heart. You are very much appreciated. However, we'd also love to show our appreciation through our perks specially for you. We welcome contributions of any size – big or small, every gift will bring us closer to achieving our goal.  For a gift of $15 or more you have the option to receive one of the special perks listed on this page – from personalized shout-outs to special mention on our website, production photos signed by casts and crew, special invitations to rehearsals, company's t-shirts and even special invitation to the premier with a hotel reservation... Awesome right?

Other ways to help make this happen!!

  1. Share with your network on Facebook and Twitter with the hashtag #WeAlmostForgot
  2. E-Mail it to your friends.
  3. Subscribe to our YouTube channel and share our videos.
  4. Use our campaign photo as your DisplayPhoto

PARTNERSHIPS

Do you have a business or organization that is interested in pursing unique cultural partnerships through sponsorship contributions? We'd love to chat with you about additional perks available for businesses and organizations.  (Give us a shout at info@ykprojects.com for more details!)

We are as well still open for co-production on the road to the premier!

story:
Kinetics- a new play by Sue Wylie

What can a middle-aged woman with Parkinson's and a young lad into free running possibly have in common? The desire to move.

“An amazing story that needs to be told”  - The Dorset Echo
“Fantastic, fresh and original production. The sort of th

ing we need more of”  - Dr Ian Johnson

“The play is a wonderful vehicle to give the public a real insight into living with Parkinson's" - Audience Member

About me

My name is Sue Wylie and I am a professional actress with over 30 years experience. I have appeared in various sitcoms on tv, including The Two of Us and worked extensively in the theatre. Highlights include writing and performing a one-woman show, In Search of Stardom, and being part of the BBC radio rep. Kinetics is my latest play based on my own true story.

Five years ago I was diagnosed with early onset Parkinson's.
It was a shock. There was a stigma attached in telling people.
It wasn't very sexy.
Parkinson's is a degenerative neurological condition which affects the cells that control movement.
As a professional actress it wasn't great news.
I felt very alone.
There are a lot of misconceptions about the disease and people can be anxious about asking questions.
I wanted to use the medium of theatre to better inform people.


Then I met Laszlo...

16 years old, bright.
Bored with school.
Finding it difficult to fit in.
Parents back in Switzerland.
His release was parkour or free running… sometimes on the school roof.


About the play

Laszlo clearly needed something to anchor him at school so we talked about writing a piece of drama. And then it hit me, the idea for a play was right under my nose, an unlikely friendship between two people seemingly at polar opposites:

Rose -has Parkinson's and her world of movement is being slowly eroded

Lukas- is young, headstrong and potentially set on course for disaster.

But they have more in common than they think.

And so Kinetics was borne.

                                      


The Aims

Kinetics has given me the opportunity to write something informative, humorous and accessible to help provide insight and challenge some of the attitudes towards Parkinson's. The play also offers a glimpse into the workings of the adolescent brain and an addiction to high risk.

The play's objectives are to:

  • Look at the social and medical issues surrounding both characters.
  • Touch upon the fear of medication and the potentially profound side effects.
  • Raise awareness of Parkinson's and what it is like to live with the condition.
  • Highlight the sometimes difficult doctor-patient relationship.
  • Provide a platform for people to share their experiences and ask tough questions through the post show Q&A - these will be facilitated by medical experts.
  • Use humour to tackle some of the more challenging issues.
  • Attract a younger audience with sequences of live parkour.
Most important is that the play is dramatically entertaining in its own right regardless of whether the audience have a connection with Parkinson's.

                  


What we have achieved

Dorchester Arts have taken on Kinetics as a co-commission and offered invaluable support, particularly with publicity and marketing. This is an ongoing partnership. 

Kinetics is now under the umbrella of DT2productions a newly formed not-for-profit Charitable Incorporated Organisation.

With a donation from my local branch of Parkinson's UK we have staged three sell-out performances. The response has been beyond anything I could have imagined:

  • We received incredibly positive audience feedback and press reviews.
  • People returned a second time to see the show and we had to turn many away.
  • The post-show question-and-answer discussion which is an integral part of the evening, clearly had a cathartic effect on many in the audience.
  • A feature in Parkinson's UK national magazine (circulation 34,000) resulted in people from all over the country asking where they could see the show.

Everyone agreed the play should be seen on a wider scale, but funding is needed and that's where we hope you will help.


Where are we now?

Parkinson's UK HQ are now supporting the project.

We have a professional team lined up as well as 12 venues wanting to take the show.

We have applied for funding from the Arts Council and some charitable trusts but need to do our own fundraising too: £10,000 will make the difference and get the play on tour.

The money will go towards production costs, designing and building the set, paying our dedicated professional team of actors, director, stage manager, lighting and film technicians at the proper rate. They have all generously contributed countless hours of time for a nominal rate. The money also goes towards costumes, props, rehearsal space, travel and accommodation as well as publicity and marketing.


We have come so far in an incredibly short period of time and I feel driven to get this play on tour. I've seen the impact it has. You can be part of Kinetics success by donating and enabling us to get the play on the road. Any proceeds from the tour will be used to extend the reach of the play and it's potential for tv or film. This is just the beginning. 

Thank you very much for your support.

story:
Breve reseña

Revuelo es una compañía de teatro peruana que hace teatro divertido, reflexivo y muy creativo. Somos profesionales del teatro: dirigimos, actuamos, escribimos,  iluminamos, cantamos, bailamos, coreografiamos! Hemos organizado, producido, y administrados uno y mil proyectos, desde un Solo en algún barcito, hasta un auto sacramental en alguna catedral. Hemos fracasado y entonces aprendido; hemos vencido y celebrado. Una y mil veces. Y es que ya no estamos tan chicos, tenemos entre 30 y 40 años. 

“La humilde dinamita” es una obra de teatro que cuenta la historia de Jonás, un chico reclutado por su propia hermana para ser parte de una columna terrorista. La obra relata la transformación de Jonás, de su triste timidez hacia una explosiva agresividad. Jonás camina por todas las etapas de la guerra, vinculándose con diversos personajes: militares, civiles, políticos y seres metafísicos… La obra es una oportunidad para escuchar a cada uno de los personajes y comprender sus posturas, las razones que cada uno tuvo, para optar por la violencia. 

La historia es dramática pero no hemos podido huir del humor. Hemos creado un texto intenso aunque enfocado de forma lúdica (no somos fans del dramón). Además nos encanta mezclar lenguajes, así que teatro, video, danza, lucha y música, todo irá junto.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos s/.42,000  o  $14,000 

Ese dinero es para cubrir todos los gastos que cuesta poner la obra en escena. Escenografía, Vestuario, Musicalización, Realización de video, Iluminación, Arte Gráfico, Traslados, Coreografía, Seguros, Sala de ensayos etc etc etc. 

Lo interesante de aportar en este proyecto, es que tu apoyo será milimétricamente sustentado ante Sunat (entidad que fiscaliza los tributos en Perú). LA HUMILDE DINAMITA se realiza bajo la razón social Asociación Teatro Veloz (asociación cultural sin fines de lucro en la que cada ingreso y egreso debe estar registrado). Y si algo sobrara (dificil pero posible), ese dinero debe reinvertirse en la Asociación. Si por ejemplo, sobraran s/.1000, podemos ofrecer una beca para que alguien de escasos recursos entre gratuitamente a los talleres que dictamos.

Entonces, todo tu dinero será utilizado formalmente y con transparencia (:

IMPACTO

Todo lo que sale del forro impacta. Y más si vamos a contar una parte dura de la historia del Perú. Y más, si es una historia con la que cualquier ciudadano del mundo podría identificarse. Y más si la obra busca respuestas a la violencia humana… Y más si las llegamos a encontrar! Y más aún si las podemos compartir con un público! Y más si alguito llega a cambiar. 

Tal vez solo movamos un centímentro a la montaña, pero la moveremos. Y  de cm en cm avanza el mundo.

Estrenamos en Lima (¡El 4 de mayo del 2016!), pero luego llevaremos la obra por toda América. Queremos contar lo que pasó en el Perú y compartir nuestras reflexiones con países que también tengan problemas de violencia... (Y quién no los tiene...). Desde siempre nos ha gustado movernos y llevar nuestras creaciones por todo el continente.
